story:
the idea:
The idea is very simple.
To invent a sport shoe able to fit in every size and grows with the foot. Resistant and durable.
Very cheap, easy to fabricate and free for everybody who needs.
We want to take advantage of the technology, the new materials and the ultimate fabrication systems without forgetting the traditional ones.
We want to use the new ways of communicating, financing and collaboration between people and then finance and fabricate (or much better fabricate with the local industries) free sneakers for the third world.
Helping with shoes, helping with jobs. 
Let's make an effort (creative, economical and personal) to try to make the life of the disadvantaged a bit better.
There are 1 billion of children in the  world living in poverty and around  300 million of these  children lack a pair of adequate shoes.
http://www.unicef.org/sowc05/english/childhoodunderthreat.html

Diseases directly related with the lack of shoes as Podoconiosis (AKA Mossy foot) and soil parasites affects every year to 740 millions of people. This situation stigmatizes and reduces the affected possibilities of having a decent future with a decent job or attending to school.

http://www.who.int/neglected_diseases/diseases/podoconiosis/en/

 

La idea:

Se trata de una idea muy simple.

Inventar unas zapatillas capaces de adaptarse a cualquier talla y crecer con el pie de quien las usa. Resistentes y duraderas. Muy baratas, sencillas de fabricar y accesibles de manera gratuita a todo aquel que las necesite.

Queremos aprovechar los avances de la tecnología, los nuevos materiales y los nuevos sistemas de fabricación pero sin olvidarnos de los métodos artesanales.

Queremos sacar partido de los nuevos modos de comunicación, financiación y colaboración entre personas y así poder diseñar, financiar, fabricar (o mejor que fabriquen las industrias locales) zapatillas gratuitas para el tercer mundo.

Ayudar dando zapatos y ayudar dando trabajo.

Hacer un esfuerzo (creativo, económico y personal) para tratar de hacer la vida de los desfavorecidos un poco mejor.

De los mil millones de niños del mundo que viven en la extrema pobreza se estima que aproximadamente 300 millones de ellos no tienen acceso a un par de zapatos.http://www.unicef.org/sowc05/english/childhoodunderthreat.html

Enfermedades directamente relacionadas con la carencia de calzado, como la Podoconiosis o los parásitos del suelo afectan anualmente a 740 millones de personas. Estas enfermedades imposibilitan que el individuo pueda desarrollar una vida digna. Sin trabajo, sin escolarización y sufriendo una enfermedad considerada una lacra social sus opciones de futuro apenas existen.

http://www.who.int/neglected_diseases/diseases/podoconiosis/en/

 

                

¿Por qué apoyar esta iniciativa?

Existen muchas iniciativas sociales para ayudar al tercer mundo mediante la donación de lo que en occidente ya no queremos (lo que ya no usamos o consideramos caducado); medicamentos, alimentos, ropa, juguetes, libros, incluso calzado.

Existen otras iniciativas de donación de calzado basadas en regalar un par de zapatos nuevos por cada par de zapatos vendido en occidente.

Regalar en África zapatos fabricados en China termina por destruir las pocas industrias locales del calzado y un bienintencionado gesto acaba causando un daño impredecible.

Todas ellas son buenas iniciativas pero fundamentadas en una visión errónea del término “compartir”.

Compartir las sobras no es compartir, regalar sin medir las consecuencias es una imprudencia…. pero al menos ambas cosas son mejor que nada.

Esta idea busca ayudar y calzar a todos los desfavorecidos, niños y adultos, y permitirles estrenar dignamente sus zapatillas (diseñadas y financiadas en occidente pero fabricadas en el tercer mundo y para el tercer mundo).

Un gesto de respeto y solidaridad en que cada uno podrá ayudar como crea o pueda.

Esta iniciativa no pretende despertar malas conciencias ni sentimientos de culpa, solo ayudar a quien lo necesita desde la perspectiva de dos personas normales, con sus virtudes y sus defectos.  

Disfrutemos de la vida y con ella disfrutemos de nuestros caprichos, pero hagámoslo sin olvidarnos de quien no tiene. 

 

Why help this initiative:

There are many social initiatives to help the third world by donating the waste and what nobody wants (second hand or out of date goods); medicines, food, clothes, toys, books and shoes too.

There are another initiatives about donating new shoes following the "BOGO" model of buy one and gift one to the third world. To gift in Africa shoes made in China destroys the fragile local industries and a well-intentioned act became in an impredictable damage.

All are good initiatives but founded in a wrong meaning of "sharing". To share the leftovers is not share, to gift without measuring the consequences is a imprudence... but at lest both thing are better than nothing.   

Our Idea looks for the best way to help and gift shoes to children and adults and let they wear with dignity a brand new pair of sneakers (designed and financed in the western world but fabricated in the third world for the third world).
A solidary and respect gesture where everyone would help somehow. 
 
We don't want to awake any bad feelings, just help the people who need it from the perspective of the common people, with virtues and defects. 
Let's enjoy life and let's enjoy our little pleasures but let's do it taking care of the have-nots.

 

Los pasos para completar el proyecto:

1er paso:

El primer paso del proyecto es lanzar un concurso internacional de ideas.

Será un concurso sin premio ni ganador en que se seleccionarán las mejores ideas para tratar de crear un prototipo que nos permita avanzar hasta el segundo paso.

Serán bienvenidas todas las ideas, ya sean escritas, dibujadas, fotografiadas... Ideas sobre las zapatillas en su totalidad o simplemente sobre un pequeño detalle.

Diseñadores, arquitectos, estudiantes, escuelas de diseño, ingenieros, o cualquier persona que tenga una idea y quiera compartirla podrá enviárnoslas a la dirección de correo electrónico de contacto.

Publicaremos en la web y en nuestra página de Facebook todas las ideas aportadas y los nombres de todos aquellos que deseen constar como colaboradores o sponsors.

Los derechos sobre la idea o ideas que conformarán el prototipo siempre pertenecerán a quien las envíe y nosotros solamente actuaremos como un mero canal para conseguir que se fabrique.

En este primer paso necesitamos vuestra ayuda de la siguiente forma:

  1. -Enviando ideas y diseños originales para las zapatillas del tercer mundo.
  2. -Mediante aportaciones económicas a través de las diferentes plataformas de crowdfunding de nuestro proyecto, que servirán para publicitar el concurso y financiar la fabricación de los prototipos necesarios.
  3. -Ayudando a fabricar los prototipos en tu taller, tu fábrica, o con los medios que tengas.
  4. -Difundiendo y fomentando esta iniciativa para que vuestro entorno personal y laboral se involucre. 

 

The steps to complete the project.
 
1st Step:
The first step is about launch an international tender of ideas.
A tender without prize and without winner where we will select the best ideas in order to create a prototype that allows us reach the next step.
All types of ideas will be welcome. Whiten, sketched, photographed.... Ideas about the complete sneakers or just a single detail. 
Designers, architects, students, schools of design, engineers or any person with a good idea can share it with us in our contact email address.
We will publish in our web page and in our facebook profile all the shared ideas and the name of everyone who desire to appear as contributor or sponsor.
The ownership of the conforming ideas of the prototype will belong always to the original author and we will act just as intermediaries to coordinate the engineering and fabrication.
In this first step we will need your help in this way:
  1. Sharing you ideas for the third world sneakers with us.
  2. Financing our project through the different crowd-funding platforms where our project is. With this money we will promote and advertise our tender and pay the expenses of fabricate the prototypes.
  3. Helping us fabricating the prototypes in your factory, warehouse or with your resources.
  4. Expanding our initiative by making your work colleges and family know about and get into it. Let's make a lot of noise. 

 

2º Paso:

Una vez se tengan los primeros prototipos comenzaremos a trazar el plan de viabilidad de la fabricación y distribución masiva de las zapatillas.

Dependiendo de las vías de financiación y crecimiento de la iniciativa seleccionaremos los países, poblaciones e industrias con las que establecer los acuerdos de desarrollo basándonos en criterios de honestidad y fiabilidad.

Cuidaremos especialmente evitar un crecimiento industrial desestabilizador que pueda propiciar el enriquecimiento ilícito de las autoridades o las industrias. Se trata de crecer mediante la propagación de pequeñas fábricas de carácter local en diferentes países capaces de abastecer la demanda de la región.

Buscaremos grandes fabricantes dispuestos a ayudar aportando maquinaria o financiación para equipar a las pequeñas industrias locales. También el apoyo de profesionales del sector y de la artesanía dispuestos a enseñar los métodos de fabricación adecuados para optimizar los costes de nuestras zapatillas.

En esta fase del proyecto necesitaremos toda la difusión posible en medios de comunicación. Revistas de moda, tendencias o actualidad; periódicos, radio y televisión. Cuanto mayor eco se hagan los medios más facil resultará conseguir nuestras metas.

En este segundo paso necesitamos vuestra ayuda de la siguiente manera:

  1. -Si eres una gran marca o fabricante y quieres ayudar financiando o equipando a una pequeña industria local.
  2. -Si eres una gran marca o fabricante y quieres asumir la plena financiación del proyecto.
  3. -Enseñando a las industrias locales cómo fabricar y sacar partido a la nueva maquinaria.
  4. -Mediante pequeñas aportaciones que nos permitan comprar y equipar a las industrias locales.
  5. -Colaborando como consultor legal para llegar a los acuerdos adecuados con cada participante.
  6. -Donando materias primas: tejidos, plásticos, derivados reciclados o componentes para la zapatilla. 
  7. Publicitando la iniciativa en medios de comunicación.

 

2nd Step:

In the moment that we have the first prototypes we will start tracing the viability plan of the mass fabrication and distribution of the sneakers.
Depending of the support obtained, the magnitude of our different sponsors and growing capacity we will select the countries, populations and industries to establish our development agreements, always focused in the honesty and reliability criteria.
We will take special care of avoid any destabilizer industrial growing that can generate the illicit enrichment of the authorities or industries. It's about growing but by spreading small local factories in different countries with capacity for the regional necessities.
We will try to make the big shoe brands get into our initiative by giving us machines and tools or money to create or equip small local factories. At the same time we will look for support from the shoe industry professionals or artisans  with the will of teaching the adequate methods of fabrication to optimize the production cost of our sneakers. 
In this second step we will need all the possible diffusion in the mass media. TV, radio, newspapers, magazines. As loud as we can make our voice closer will be our goal.  
In this second step we need you help in this way:
  1. If you are a mayor brand of shoes or manufacturer and you want to finance or equip a local industry. 
  2. If you are a mayor brand of shoes and you want to be our main sponsor by financing a big part of the project.
  3. Teaching the local industries how to fabricate and squeeze new machines and tools.
  4. By small economical donations letting us buy used machines and tools to equip local industries.
  5. Helping us as legal consultant to close all the adequate deals with all the parties.
  6. Donating material, textiles, plastics, recycled materials or components for the sneakers.
  7. publishing our initiative in mass media.
story_txt:
the idea:
The idea is very simple.
To invent a sport shoe able to fit in every size and grows with the foot. Resistant and durable.
Very cheap, easy to fabricate and free for everybody who needs.
We want to take advantage of the technology, the new materials and the ultimate fabrication systems without forgetting the traditional ones.
We want to use the new ways of communicating, financing and collaboration between people and then finance and fabricate (or much better fabricate with the local industries) free sneakers for the third world.
Helping with shoes, helping with jobs. 
Let's make an effort (creative, economical and personal) to try to make the life of the disadvantaged a bit better.

There are 1 billion of children in the  world living in poverty and around  300 million of these  children lack a pair of adequate shoes.


http://www.unicef.org/sowc05/english/childhoodunderthreat.html

Diseases directly related with the lack of shoes as Podoconiosis (AKA Mossy foot) and soil parasites affects every year to 740 millions of people. This situation stigmatizes and reduces the affected possibilities of having a decent future with a decent job or attending to school.
http://www.who.int/neglected_diseases/diseases/podoconiosis/en/

 
La idea:
Se trata de una idea muy simple.
Inventar unas zapatillas capaces de adaptarse a cualquier talla y crecer con el pie de quien las usa. Resistentes y duraderas. Muy baratas, sencillas de fabricar y accesibles de manera gratuita a todo aquel que las necesite.
Queremos aprovechar los avances de la tecnología, los nuevos materiales y los nuevos sistemas de fabricación pero sin olvidarnos de los métodos artesanales.
Queremos sacar partido de los nuevos modos de comunicación, financiación y colaboración entre personas y así poder diseñar, financiar, fabricar (o mejor que fabriquen las industrias locales) zapatillas gratuitas para el tercer mundo.
Ayudar dando zapatos y ayudar dando trabajo.
Hacer un esfuerzo (creativo, económico y personal) para tratar de hacer la vida de los desfavorecidos un poco mejor.
De los mil millones de niños del mundo que viven en la extrema pobreza se estima que aproximadamente 300 millones de ellos no tienen acceso a un par de zapatos.http://www.unicef.org/sowc05/english/childhoodunderthreat.html
Enfermedades directamente relacionadas con la carencia de calzado, como la Podoconiosis o los parásitos del suelo afectan anualmente a 740 millones de personas. Estas enfermedades imposibilitan que el individuo pueda desarrollar una vida digna. Sin trabajo, sin escolarización y sufriendo una enfermedad considerada una lacra social sus opciones de futuro apenas existen.
http://www.who.int/neglected_diseases/diseases/podoconiosis/en/
 
                
¿Por qué apoyar esta iniciativa?
Existen muchas iniciativas sociales para ayudar al tercer mundo mediante la donación de lo que en occidente ya no queremos (lo que ya no usamos o consideramos caducado); medicamentos, alimentos, ropa, juguetes, libros, incluso calzado.
Existen otras iniciativas de donación de calzado basadas en regalar un par de zapatos nuevos por cada par de zapatos vendido en occidente.
Regalar en África zapatos fabricados en China termina por destruir las pocas industrias locales del calzado y un bienintencionado gesto acaba causando un daño impredecible.
Todas ellas son buenas iniciativas pero fundamentadas en una visión errónea del término “compartir”.
Compartir las sobras no es compartir, regalar sin medir las consecuencias es una imprudencia…. pero al menos ambas cosas son mejor que nada.
Esta idea busca ayudar y calzar a todos los desfavorecidos, niños y adultos, y permitirles estrenar dignamente sus zapatillas (diseñadas y financiadas en occidente pero fabricadas en el tercer mundo y para el tercer mundo).
Un gesto de respeto y solidaridad en que cada uno podrá ayudar como crea o pueda.
Esta iniciativa no pretende despertar malas conciencias ni sentimientos de culpa, solo ayudar a quien lo necesita desde la perspectiva de dos personas normales, con sus virtudes y sus defectos.  
Disfrutemos de la vida y con ella disfrutemos de nuestros caprichos, pero hagámoslo sin olvidarnos de quien no tiene. 
 
Why help this initiative:
There are many social initiatives to help the third world by donating the waste and what nobody wants (second hand or out of date goods); medicines, food, clothes, toys, books and shoes too.
There are another initiatives about donating new shoes following the "BOGO" model of buy one and gift one to the third world. To gift in Africa shoes made in China destroys the fragile local industries and a well-intentioned act became in an impredictable damage.
All are good initiatives but founded in a wrong meaning of "sharing". To share the leftovers is not share, to gift without measuring the consequences is a imprudence... but at lest both thing are better than nothing.   
Our Idea looks for the best way to help and gift shoes to children and adults and let they wear with dignity a brand new pair of sneakers (designed and financed in the western world but fabricated in the third world for the third world).
A solidary and respect gesture where everyone would help somehow. 
 
We don't want to awake any bad feelings, just help the people who need it from the perspective of the common people, with virtues and defects. 
Let's enjoy life and let's enjoy our little pleasures but let's do it taking care of the have-nots.
 
Los pasos para completar el proyecto:
1er paso:
El primer paso del proyecto es lanzar un concurso internacional de ideas.
Será un concurso sin premio ni ganador en que se seleccionarán las mejores ideas para tratar de crear un prototipo que nos permita avanzar hasta el segundo paso.
Serán bienvenidas todas las ideas, ya sean escritas, dibujadas, fotografiadas... Ideas sobre las zapatillas en su totalidad o simplemente sobre un pequeño detalle.
Diseñadores, arquitectos, estudiantes, escuelas de diseño, ingenieros, o cualquier persona que tenga una idea y quiera compartirla podrá enviárnoslas a la dirección de correo electrónico de contacto.
Publicaremos en la web y en nuestra página de Facebook todas las ideas aportadas y los nombres de todos aquellos que deseen constar como colaboradores o sponsors.
Los derechos sobre la idea o ideas que conformarán el prototipo siempre pertenecerán a quien las envíe y nosotros solamente actuaremos como un mero canal para conseguir que se fabrique.
En este primer paso necesitamos vuestra ayuda de la siguiente forma:

-Enviando ideas y diseños originales para las zapatillas del tercer mundo.

-Mediante aportaciones económicas a través de las diferentes plataformas de crowdfunding de nuestro proyecto, que servirán para publicitar el concurso y financiar la fabricación de los prototipos necesarios.

story:
Check Out Our Website:

http://parablenewyork.com/

Visit our website for updates on our process, designs, clothing, team and blog. We will be updating it regularly with new stuff so check it out and enjoy. On our website we have started our very own blog called the "Collective." The Collective showcases the artistic ventures and talents of our friends and people we admire, while also remaining a space for us to post periodic updates about Parable as well. This is a space for creativity and more importantly a space for people to enjoy. It contains good music, art, design, photography, film and much more.

Parable

We are two high school students from NYC determined to establish our own clothing company, with your help that is. We are beginning the company through our school as part of the Senior Project program available to seniors. As a part of the project we get two weeks off in May (the 13th through 28th) to hound away at our goal 24/7. For us, this company does not stop once we graduate and our Senior Project period is over. We are not two students who want to sell some tees to our friends. We are ambitious in the goal and scope of our Senior Project because we want this to be a legitimate fully functioning business that we can continue for years to come.With your help we are positive that we can achieve our goal. Thanks.

The proposal required to be admitted into the Senior Project program at our school that outlines our entire two weeks off as well as the company plan is below. Our estimated expenses (what your help is going towards) is also listed below:

 

Proposal:

Abstract:

Parable will be a fully developed clothing company out of New York City. Created and designed by my partner (Devon Kasarjian) and I, it reflects the style of clothing that we would desire to wear and feel comfortable in. Clothing/textile design will be researched at such locations as the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Library along with learning and utilizing screen/silk-screen printing methods. Manufacturers will be contacted and factories visited in order to obtain shirts to be used. The goal is to make this brand fully functional and legitimate by establishing a presence. Clothing will be able to be manufactured, ordered, and bought. We want to completely begin a brand at the ground floor with only up to go. Our intended outcome is to develop not only the designs to be printed on our clothing, manufacture clothing, screenprint said designs, but also establish a business plan, online presence and marketing campaign.

 

Rationale:

This project serves as real world work experience in a field of great interest as well as to teach independence. Independence and professionalism in an area of interest is a trait that has been prevalent throughout my life-long education at Friends Seminary (where we attend). As students we have always been inspired to experience and investigate what interests us. I also feel that by extension we learn how to become better members of communities whether local or on a global scale through experience. We are a community of learners and what better way then learn from experience. I want this project to serve as inspiration but also to promote dialogue. I want others to reflect and discuss not only the physical project but also the capabilities of high school students.

 

Responsibilities and Schedule:

Because I want to establish a brand for my Senior Project there are numerous tasks and factors to be taken into account (which makes it rather ambitious) to be completed before the two weeks and during as well.

Before May 13 the designs and business plan will need to be finalized with very small alterations to be made. A company or manufacturer will need to have been selected based upon the desired material, quantity etc. A clothing printing studio will need to be found in order to learn to print as well as consult with. I have been in contact with the manager at Works in Progress on the Lower East Side. The appropriate funds for this project will need to be raised as well. We also understand that cost, though we have already started raising, can be a limiting factor which might alter the intended outcome.

During the two weeks (13 - 28), learning the screenprinting/silkscreening method will be achieved through taking classes and participating in open studio events at a printing studio. Also, the clothing will need to be ordered and printed during this time. Since our business plan and intended outcome includes a marketing plan, we plan on designing stickers, developing a photographic and video lookbook in addition to a website and email. We have already contacted people to model our clothing as well as shoot the lookbook at a location, which needs to be found.

 

The first week will be dedicated to working with screens and the materials that were purchased prior in order to become independent in the silk screening method. This will be done by taking a seminar at a print shop as well as time with consultants as to how best to print our designs. Time will then be spent during the days at the shop in their workspace during allotted times to practice and perform the methods. The physical clothing will have had to be ordered befor this first week in order to do said printing. Designs will also be finalized during this period and scheduling for the following week established as well. The website will be started and the stickers ordered.

Following, the second week will be a busy push period in which the lookbook will be shot and edited. Locations will have been researched and found prior to the shoot. The model has already been contacted and has agreed to participate. This video and photographic lookbook will be put up on the website. Everything will be finalized, organized, and prepared for presentation.

 

It must be restated that due to the sheer scale of this project and because of the cost component (though a business plan is essential) may alter the intended outcome. In the allotted time it may not be possible to complete the full marketing plan. In addition, based upon cost and budget estimates the quantity of shirts and amount able to be printed will be evaluated. I have the utmost intention of completing every single aspect I have outlined, though I completely understand there are certain factors that may be out of my control.

 

Experiential Component:

Since the intention of this project is to fully establish a brand and clothing company, built from the ground up, the project is heavily reliant on and involved actively in the field. This project is work experience and experience in what it takes to start a company. Design will be researched at design libraries such as the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Library as well as Parsons. Factories and manufactures will be located and visited in order to get price estimates as well as the required clothing that suits our standards. Also, clothing printing methods will be learned, practiced and implemented at print workshops such as Works in Progress or 3rd Ward. A presence will then be developed online and through social media. Also, meetings with advisors, both of which have extensive work experience and knowledge of the process, will be arranged and held. All of these experiences present different aspects of the business and field that is trying to be broken into during the course of this project. I see myself on foot roaming the city for the best places to print and manufacture clothes, really reveling in my entrepreneurship and really appreciating the effort and time it takes to create clothing.

 

Supplemental Book:

Paul Rand: Conversations with Students

Kroeger, Michael. Paul Rand: Conversations with Students. N.p.: Princeton Architectural, 2008. Print.

Paul Rand: A Designer’s Art

Rand, Paul. Paul Rand: A Designer's Art. New Haven: Yale UP, 1985. Print.

 

In both of these publications, timeless and influential designer Paul Rand shares his words & thoughts on varied topics ranging from design philosophy to design education. Being not only a designer but philosopher, his work conveys an expression of beauty, innovation, sensibility, and himself on a personal level. He is a design legend with much to learn from. What he is able to do is display graphically designs that conveys his own nature and the nature of his clients and viewers. This is essentially the main goal of this senior project above all else. We want to develop clothing that reflects our nature and the nature of the wearers through the designs we place upon the garments. These books are verbal statements of the theories as to how to best achieve this goal.

 

Expenses:

Printing

whether digital or screen, prices vary for color quantity, number of styles etc.

the plan so far is to screen print

 

Shirts

buy shirts from wholesale source

online or from showroom/order from location

pay for samples of styles if need be

 

Labeling/relabeling

custom label, process of removing and reinstalling etc.

 

Shipping and transportation costs

shipping shirts both from warehouse and to customers, transporting them,mass transit (subway, gas) to lookbook location etc.

 

Website

domain name, server and keeping site afloat for at least a year, format at yearly/monthly rate, pay pal

 

Packaging

the individual packaging of shirts to be shipped/bought etc.

 

Stickers

to be included as bonus in packaging, part of marketing campaign, could be bought seperate, spread around city

 

Screen Printing Class

On LES

pay for class, studio time, equipment etc.

will use the uniqlo t-shirts to cut expenses and to practice

 

Marketing

pay for ads or shout outs/linkage to our website on reputable style blogs etc. can be very expensive but worthwhile

 

NOTE:

we are also accounting for that fact that we will have to give out free shirts to people for their participation in the project or to hype our brand (i.e. model in lookbook, photographer/videographer, representative/hyper)

We are ambitious in the goal and scope of our Senior Project because we want this to be a legitimate fully functioning business that we can continue for years to come.With your help we are positive that we can achieve our goal. Thanks.
The proposal required to be admitted into the Senior Project program at our school that outlines our entire two weeks off as well as the company plan is below. Our estimated expenses (what your help is going towards) is also listed below:
 
Proposal:
Abstract:
Parable will be a fully developed clothing company out of New York City. Created and designed by my partner (Devon Kasarjian) and I, it reflects the style of clothing that we would desire to wear and feel comfortable in. Clothing/textile design will be researched at such locations as the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Library along with learning and utilizing screen/silk-screen printing methods. Manufacturers will be contacted and factories visited in order to obtain shirts to be used. The goal is to make this brand fully functional and legitimate by establishing a presence. Clothing will be able to be manufactured, ordered, and bought. We want to completely begin a brand at the ground floor with only up to go. Our intended outcome is to develop not only the designs to be printed on our clothing, manufacture clothing, screenprint said designs, but also establish a business plan, online presence and marketing campaign.
 
Rationale:
This project serves as real world work experience in a field of great interest as well as to teach independence. Independence and professionalism in an area of interest is a trait that has been prevalent throughout my life-long education at Friends Seminary (where we attend). As students we have always been inspired to experience and investigate what interests us. I also feel that by extension we learn how to become better members of communities whether local or on a global scale through experience. We are a community of learners and what better way then learn from experience. I want this project to serve as inspiration but also to promote dialogue. I want others to reflect and discuss not only the physical project but also the capabilities of high school students.
 
Responsibilities and Schedule:
Because I want to establish a brand for my Senior Project there are numerous tasks and factors to be taken into account (which makes it rather ambitious) to be completed before the two weeks and during as well.
Before May 13 the designs and business plan will need to be finalized with very small alterations to be made. A company or manufacturer will need to have been selected based upon the desired material, quantity etc. A clothing printing studio will need to be found in order to learn to print as well as consult with. I have been in contact with the manager at Works in Progress on the Lower East Side. The appropriate funds for this project will need to be raised as well. We also understand that cost, though we have already started raising, can be a limiting factor which might alter the intended outcome.
During the two weeks (13 - 28), learning the screenprinting/silkscreening method will be achieved through taking classes and participating in open studio events at a printing studio. Also, the clothing will need to be ordered and printed during this time. Since our business plan and intended outcome includes a marketing plan, we plan on designing stickers, developing a photographic and video lookbook in addition to a website and email. We have already contacted people to model our clothing as well as shoot the lookbook at a location, which needs to be found.
 
The first week will be dedicated to working with screens and the materials that were purchased prior in order to become independent in the silk screening method. This will be done by taking a seminar at a print shop as well as time with consultants as to how best to print our designs. Time will then be spent during the days at the shop in their workspace during allotted times to practice and perform the methods. The physical clothing will have had to be ordered befor this first week in order to do said printing. Designs will also be finalized during this period and scheduling for the following week established as well. The website will be started and the stickers ordered.
Following, the second week will be a busy push period in which the lookbook will be shot and edited. Locations will have been researched and found prior to the shoot. The model has already been contacted and has agreed to participate. This video and photographic lookbook will be put up on the website. Everything will be finalized, organized, and prepared for presentation.
 
It must be restated that due to the sheer scale of this project and because of the cost component (though a business plan is essential) may alter the intended outcome. In the allotted time it may not be possible to complete the full marketing plan. In addition, based upon cost and budget estimates the quantity of shirts and amount able to be printed will be evaluated. I have the utmost intention of completing every single aspect I have outlined, though I completely understand there are certain factors that may be out of my control.
 
Experiential Component:
Since the intention of this project is to fully establish a brand and clothing company, built from the ground up, the project is heavily reliant on and involved actively in the field. This project is work experience and experience in what it takes to start a company. Design will be researched at design libraries such as the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Library as well as Parsons. Factories and manufactures will be located and visited in order to get price estimates as well as the required clothing that suits our standards. Also, clothing printing methods will be learned, practiced and implemented at print workshops such as Works in Progress or 3rd Ward. A presence will then be developed online and through social media. Also, meetings with advisors, both of which have extensive work experience and knowledge of the process, will be arranged and held. All of these experiences present different aspects of the business and field that is trying to be broken into during the course of this project. I see myself on foot roaming the city for the best places to print and manufacture clothes, really reveling in my entrepreneurship and really appreciating the effort and time it takes to create clothing.
 
Supplemental Book:
Paul Rand: Conversations with Students
Kroeger, Michael. Paul Rand: Conversations with Students. N.p.: Princeton Architectural, 2008. Print.
Paul Rand: A Designer’s Art
Rand, Paul. Paul Rand: A Designer's Art. New Haven: Yale UP, 1985. Print.
 
In both of these publications, timeless and influential designer Paul Rand shares his words & thoughts on varied topics ranging from design philosophy to design education. Being not only a designer but philosopher, his work conveys an expression of beauty, innovation, sensibility, and himself on a personal level. He is a design legend with much to learn from. What he is able to do is display graphically designs that conveys his own nature and the nature of his clients and viewers. This is essentially the main goal of this senior project above all else. We want to develop clothing that reflects our nature and the nature of the wearers through the designs we place upon the garments. These books are verbal statements of the theories as to how to best achieve this goal.
 
Expenses:
Printing
whether digital or screen, prices vary for color quantity, number of styles etc.
the plan so far is to screen print
 
Shirts
buy shirts from wholesale source
online or from showroom/order from location
pay for samples of styles if need be
 
Labeling/relabeling
custom label, process of removing and reinstalling etc.
 
Shipping and transportation costs
shipping shirts both from warehouse and to customers, transporting them,mass transit (subway, gas) to lookbook location etc.
 
Website
domain name, server and keeping site afloat for at least a year, format at yearly/monthly rate, pay pal
 
Packaging
the individual packaging of shirts to be shipped/bought etc.
 
Stickers
to be included as bonus in packaging, part of marketing campaign, could be bought seperate, spread around city
 
Screen Printing Class
On LES
pay for class, studio time, equipment etc.
will use the uniqlo t-shirts to cut expenses and to practice
 
Marketing
pay for ads or shout outs/linkage to our website on reputable style blogs etc. can be very expensive but worthwhile
 
NOTE:
we are also accounting for that fact that we will have to give out free shirts to people for their participation in the project or to hype our brand (i.e. model in lookbook, photographer/videographer, representative/hyper)

story:
We spent 18 months, redesigning a backpack with the feedback of our backers. We read every single comments, reviews, suggestions and blogs about the common needs of a backpack so we could design a backpack that is for everyone from professionals, adventurers, photographers, travelers, commuters to students!

 

Vegan Leather:

We use extra durable Microfiber Leather which is as durable as real leather and does not peel out. 

The back part of the backpack takes the features of private workstation mode. Sturdy and strong flaps fold out to create the ultimate on the go laptop station; a private workspace anywhere with over 15 dedicated pockets,elastic straps in and out, touch screen phone pocket, built-in USB port,extendable & protected laptop sleeve, water-resistant zippers and cut-resistant fabrics,  the list goes on with its functionalities.  

Ohh also, this bag turns heads every time so get ready to answer curious questions wherever you set it up!

 

Laptop compartment size is 16"x11"- Fits up to 15.6" Laptops- Stretchable Sleeve

 

Workstation Mode On The Go

You can use your laptop on the Moose Workstation bag without unfolding the side walls. When you need the side walls in a limited space on the go, simply unfold and snap the side walls so that keeps the bag on its position to create your own workspace anywhere.    

 

Laptop compartment size is 16"x11"- Fits all the 15.6" Laptops & some 17" Laptops- Stretchable Sleeve

 

The Moose Backpack provides instant access from all sides. When you need to reach your stuff fast, you don't have to unzip the bag all the way. Quick access design allows you to reach your laptop on the backside and books on the front side in seconds!

A retractable key fob is included in Moose backpack, that is attached to the bag meaning you don’t have to hunt for your keys.

 

The large front pocket on the backpack is one of the most practical features of the backpack. The pocket is large enough to carry even large books or enough clothes for weekend trips and because it opens fully, you do not have to hunt in the pocket to find things.

 

The inside of the bag has been designed to carry as much as you could possibly need in easy to access pockets. Special pockets for RFID documents and passports have been built in, again with super easy access. Every pocket has been designed and positioned with your convenience and ease of access in mind keeping you clutter-free on the move. 

 

Inside the large front compartment is a handy holdall that can be used to carry sunglasses, tech items or act as a very stylish pencil case or toiletry bag.

The pouch has three different water-resistant compartments that attaches inside the bag with strong velcro. 

Innovative extension system inside the main compartment helps you pack even more!

The Moose backpack's add-on camera cube keeps your equipment safe. For extra durability, we inserted double foam side walls which are shock resistant and a PP protection board inside the camera cube.   

Because the backpack has been built around travelers its size is made to measure for airline personal item bag size. This means you can always carry everything with you and your portable work space goes with you. The Moose bag makes a great carry-on bag for short trips. It looks slim but fits a lot of items!

One of the unique features of the Moose Designs Backpack is the secret sleeve on the back of the bag. This sleeve opens up on both sides and slides over the handle of wheeled suitcases and sit snuggly and safely on top to create an easy way to transport what would otherwise be two bags.

 

For style, convenience and functionality the strong straps are hidden away in another secret pocket from which the sleeves are easily pulled out and put back. Carrying the moose designs backpack in any situation has never been easier. The design makes it easy to go from briefcase to backpack and back again with elegant ease.

 

 

The straps of the backpack have been ergonomically designed for ease and comfort of transport, whether you are walking, scooting or riding the adjustable straps make carrying the backpack a pleasure knowing you and your baggage are safe and secure. 

Patent-pending, Moose Designs bag will adapt to your everyday lifestyle with its cleverly located different types of pockets and stylish design. 

We took the work patterns and activities of mobile people and applied these to an entirely new concept of backpacks to create what is now the mobile workstation bag. The biggest change that had to be made was to increase the practicality of the backpack. We built over 16 prototypes and developed the design on each time until we reached to this point. We are really happy with the final version after 18 months of testing and designing with the feedback of our backers. 

 

To ensure quality and manufacturing time, we partnered with the sector's one of the most experienced manufacturers and suppliers. This bag probably has more pockets than any other backpack out there which means each pocket, border lines, zippers, hidden and un-hidden spaces must be sewn one by one by skilled bag tailors. We are very confident with ourselves and our well experienced manufacturing partners that we will fullfill the rewards on time with the best quality, just like what we've done before with our earlier campaigns!

Who We Are 

The Moose Designs is Kickstarter born company with a team of inventors and designers, located in California. We extented our team with creative folks and listen to our backers about their daily organization needs as our focus is, creating innovative products that help people simplify, organize and improve their lives.  

 

We are here to raise enough funds to bring The Moose Designs bag to life. We need your support to establish production of the world's most functional backpack in sufficient quantities to reduce the retail price to make the product more affordable for our backers. In supporting this campaign, you will be playing your part in bringing a unique and practical bag to life. This is our third Kickstarter campaign and as we promised to our backers in our first two projects, we started to manufacture right after our campaign was ended and shipped out the rewards on time with the best quality. We have the suppliers and skilled manufacturers lined up and ready to go, now we need your support to bring The Moose Designs bag to reality with a special price for Kickstarter backers!

We can't wait to get this The Moose Designs Bag in your hands.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Specifications & Summary

Materials

  • Leather Type: Full Grain 
  • Sourced From: Florence, Italy
  • Tanning Process: Vegetable Tanned
  • Coin Pocket Zip: YKK Excella - Luxury Gold 
  • Inner Lining: Black RFID-Proof Fabric

RFID Contactless Protection

  • How it works: RFID signals are emitted to read your card details every time you scan your contactless card at the supermarket, metro, bar, etc.
  • You're protected: The entire contents of the wallet are protected from RFID signals - which means they can't be scanned while inside your wallet - except the front contactless pocket, which is purposely left open for quick contactless scanning.

Main Features

  • Cash Drawer: 15 bills 
  • 4 Main Card Slots: 4 cards 
  • Coin Pouch: 10 coins 
  • 2 Pull Tab Pockets: 6 cards 
  • 2 Secret Card Slots: 2 cards/papers 
  • Contactless Card Slip: 1 contactless card 
  • Memory Card Slot: 1 SD memory card (DSLR camera size) 
  • Nano SIM Card Slot: 1 Nano SIM card (iPhone size) 
  • House Key Slot: 1 pin tumbler key (most common house key) 
  • SIM Pin Slot: 1 SIM removal pin slot (same as iPhone SIM pin)

Colour Combinations

  • Saddle Tan - Saddle Tan Exterior - Black Interior
  • Black - Black Exterior - Saddle Tan Interior

Dimensions

  • Open Length: 175mm
  • Closed Length: 85mm
  • Open Width: 5mm
  • Closed Width: 12mm
  • Height: 105mm
  • Max Bill Length: 160mm 
  • Max Bill Height: 100mm
  • Coin Zip Length: 50mm
  • Coin Pocket Depth: 95mm
  • House Key Size: 28mm x 55mm
  • SIM Pin Size: 10mm x 27mm
  • SD Memory Card Size: 32mm x 24mm
  • Nano SIM Size: 12mm x 10mm 

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Q: What are the dimensions? How big is this feature?
  • A: Please see the specifications above for a detailed breakdown of the features and dimensions.
  • Q: How much does shipping cost to my country?
  • A: We offer free shipping to all countries in the world.
  • Q: Will I be able to track my package?
  • A: Yes, shortly after shipping you will receive an email with a direct tracking link to your specific package. The link will become active after 3 working days.
  • Q: I have another question that isn't answered here, how can I contact you?
  • A: You may contact us via the following channels and we will do our best to reply to you within the hour:
  • The Indiegogo messaging system
  • By email at: CS (at) FilippoMorato (dot) com

How it works: RFID signals are emitted to read your card details every time you scan your contactless card at the supermarket, metro, bar, etc.

You're protected: The entire contents of the wallet are protected from RFID signals - which means they can't be scanned while inside your wallet - except the front contactless pocket, which is purposely left open for quick contactless scanning.

Nano SIM Card Slot: 1 Nano SIM card (iPhone size) 

House Key Slot: 1 pin tumbler key (most common house key) 

SIM Pin Slot: 1 SIM removal pin slot (same as iPhone SIM pin)

Saddle Tan - Saddle Tan Exterior - Black Interior

Black - Black Exterior - Saddle Tan Interior

Height: 105mm

Frequently Asked Questions
Q: What are the dimensions? How big is this feature?
A: Please see the specifications above for a detailed breakdown of the features and dimensions.

Q: How much does shipping cost to my country?
A: We offer free shipping to all countries in the world.
Q: Will I be able to track my package?A: Yes, shortly after shipping you will receive an email with a direct tracking link to your specific package. The link will become active after 3 working days.
Q: I have another question that isn't answered here, how can I contact you?
A: You may contact us via the following channels and we will do our best to reply to you within the hour:
The Indiegogo messaging system
By email at: CS (at) FilippoMorato (dot) com
Shipping Details
We offer Free Tracked Shipping Worldwide. Once your order has been received, the Suave(s) will be shipped within 2 weeks (excl. public holidays).
You will then receive a tracking number for DHL eCommerce (or another service if we can make it arrive faster).
 
Refund & Return Policy
If you are unhappy with your Suave(s) you may do one of two things:
If it does not function as described, you may return it for a full refund and the return shipping.
If it is fully functional, you may return it for a refund (minus a restocking fee of $10) but please note that in this instance you will not be refunded the return shipping.
Please note: In order to begin the returns process, you must email us (within 7 days of receipt).
All items should be returned in original condition and in the original packaging.
 
Customer Support
You can get us by email at: cs@filippomorato.com
We're available 7 days a week and should reply to you within 24 hours.

story:
Half Century Jeans are as comfortable as your favourite pair of jeans, but built from a special hybrid of materials including Japanese selvedge denim, sourced from Okayama, and ultra durable Spectra fibres, which are 15x stronger than cable steel. 

Crafted by our technologically groundbreaking production team in Portugal, these are the most indestructible jeans you’ll have ever worn. 

We are so confident of this that, for the next 50 years, they will be backed with a guarantee of free repair or replacement should anything happen to them.

The fashion industry is the world’s second most polluting. 25% of the world’s chemicals are used for textile production and 10% of the world’s carbon emissions result from the apparel industry. As a result more toxic chemicals are released into our air, water and soil, and greenhouse gases are created that deplete our water and fossil fuel energy resources.

As consumers, we need to buy less and buy better, and to stop subscribing to the “fast fashion” mentality that has become so prevalent.

Half Century Jeans are deeply personal. Unlike mass produced jeans that come with faux fading or holes, they are built to last your whole life and to look better with every day of further use. Half Century Jeans are uniquely yours and were designed to demonstrate that no fabric looks better with age than denim.

Selvedge denim is made using traditional shuttle looms. These weave the cloth in a continuous cross-thread that is passed back and forth on the shuttle along the length of the bolt. As this thread loops back around, it creates a “selvedge edge”, finishing these strips of fabric with tightly woven bands that stop them from fraying or unravelling. 

Using selvedge denim is crucial to the design of the Half Century Jeans because it is more durable, better value in terms of cost per wear, made ethically and looks smarter.

Spectra is often used to produce ropes for extreme sport climbing and vests that are ballistic resistant. It has one of the highest strength to weight ratios of any manmade fibre, is resistant to chemicals, resists corrosion and it is 15 times stronger than steel. That said, it is still very light and does not compromise mobility, meaning your Half Century jeans are built to withstand the toughest wear and tear but also extremely comfortable.

All cotton used in the production of Half Century Jeans is 100% organic. Growing cotton conventionally involves the use of chemicals which cause pollution to both soil and water. This has grave consequences not only for the environment but for the people exposed to these pesticides which cause birth defects, reproductive disorders and weaker immune systems.

Organic cotton is free from pesticides, genetic modification and artificial fertilisers. This is better for the health of our planet and the people living on it: whether you’re using cotton to make clothing or a consumer wearing it.

Every pair of Half Century Jeans is backed with a 50 Year Guarantee. The idea behind this pledge is to help lead a trend towards treating fashion more sustainably. A truly well made pair of jeans is probably the most durable garment in the world. 

Half Century Jeans are specifically designed to look better with every wear but, should there be anything that needs repairing or replacing over the course of the next 50 years, our team will do this immediately and free of charge.

Any Half Century Jeans returned for replacement will be either repaired to sell second-hand or recycled to create something new using the materials.

Organic cotton is free from pesticides, genetic modification and artificial fertilisers. This is better for the health of our planet and the people living on it: whether you’re using cotton to make clothing or a consumer wearing it.

Every pair of Half Century Jeans is backed with a 50 Year Guarantee. The idea behind this pledge is to help lead a trend towards treating fashion more sustainably. A truly well made pair of jeans is probably the most durable garment in the world. 
Half Century Jeans are specifically designed to look better with every wear but, should there be anything that needs repairing or replacing over the course of the next 50 years, our team will do this immediately and free of charge.
Any Half Century Jeans returned for replacement will be either repaired to sell second-hand or recycled to create something new using the materials.

story:
* Support with a dress, bag, print, simple thank you email, or share to your right! *

 

 

THE COLLECTION!

The collection consists of 6 dresses, 12 bags and 6 prints/posters.

Each dress has a print from a different part of earth: The Antarctica, the Sea, the Desert, the Fruitgarden, the Woodlands, and the Jungle.

(The small videos show how each dress looks live!)

The fabric is organic cotton satin stretch,  the print is toxic free, all ingredients as well. The production is fair in Poland. As soon as we can, we will to work with closed loop production, we already have a partner, we only need the quantity of products, so it is possible to begin. Then, we can recycle everything, give you a discount when you return something, and work without waste!​

 

DRESSES

the Antarctica 

Kazue, from Japan, 48, Writer & Teacher

 

the Sea 

​Juliana, from Germany, 32, Actress at Ramba Zamba Theatre Berlin & TV.

 

the Desert 

​Deborah, from Nigeria, 34, Communications

 

the Fruitgarden

​Nirosha, from Sri Lanka, 37, Hair Stylist

the Woodlands 


​Caro, from Germany, 29, Politics Referee

 

 

the Jungle

​Sarina, from Germany, 21, Economic Pedagogy

 

BAGS

Organic Cotton, 140g, size: 38x42cm, handle: 70cm.
Gots certified (environmentally friendly & fair wages)

 

 

 

PRINTS/POSTERS

32x32 cm Prints/Posters (fine Igepa "Design Offset" Paper, 250 g, FSC certified)

 

LET NICOLA SHOW YOU AROUND BERLIN!

... HER MOST FAVOURITE PLACES!

Either on a bike (the greatest!!), by foot, public transport, or optionally by car!

A tour on either a saturday or sunday. Date flexible

 

 

* SUMMARY *

 

YOUR PRE-ORDER/SUPPORT WILL:

 Enable the production of the product you purchase - a dress, a bag, or a print.

The extra profit will be used, to finance the photos for the next collection, marketing activities to share the project even more. And if it is a lot you like to purchase & give, we will be able to pay someone to support with everything so the growth can be even faster.

 

MATERIAL & SIZES 

Dress:

Organic Cotton Satin stretch, 98 % Organic Cotton, 2% Elastan (Gots certified). 220g (elegant fabric weight). Toxic free print (Gots Certified). Zipper & Thread (Oekotex certified). Logo label (Oekotex certified, and made from recycled polyester).

 

 

Sizes Dress: 

xs, s, m, l, xl.

WASH, WEAR & ORGANIC CERTIFICATES

Dresses: washable 30°. Really nice to wear, because of the stretch. This means, they also almost don't wrinkle at all. So they are also great to travel!

Bags: no wash, clean with cloth

 

HOW DO I CHOOSE THE DESIGN/SIZE I WANT?

After you make your order, you will receive an email with a document where you can choose the design and in the case of the dress also the size. If you like to by more dresses, also for your friends, you can also take double sizes or designs.

If you are unsure about the size, please contact me, I will advise.

 

IS PRODUCTION READY TO START?/WHEN WILL I RECEIVE MY ORDER?

Yes! Everyone involved in making this garment is alarmed, and ready to begin! The producer of the fabric (Turkey) , the print (Netherlands), the zipper (Germany), the logo label (Netherlands), the thread (Switzerland) and finally the manufacturing plant (in Poland)!

As soon as this campaign is finished (June 20):

a. Prints: the prints will be printed on paper, and send out to you between June 22-30

b. Bags: the bags will be printed, and send out to you between June 29-July 5 (the time frame is because the printer has a 7-10 day lead time)

c. Dresses: the fabric will be printed, and all ingredients (thread, zipper, labels) will be ordered. This takes about 4-5 weeks. Everything will be send to Poland, where it will take about 4-6 weeks to produce. By the end of August we are ready to send you your dresses! (I am sure it is worth the wait. The quality of the dresses is really beautiful. People who have seen the dresses say, even more in reality than on picture).

 

*

* * *   Please share! (on top of the page, to your right!)  * * *

The more people find out the better!

and visit: www.nicolametzger.com
