story:
AN ITALIAN PROJECT CREATED AROUND THE CONCEPT OF SHARING

For us, sharing is more than a good intention: it’s a daily practice and our de facto fundamental trait. We wanted to make this clear from the very beginning by inserting it in the brand name “teeshare”: a composite of the word “sharing” and “tee” as a diminutive of t-shirt, our staple product. 

We financed the launch of the teeshare project ourselves, with our own resources. This time around, we need a little help to cover some of the expenses to develop the new collection, which we would like to present in October. With your support, we can create new teeshare models, develop two new prototypes, purchase the fabric and create new personalized articles with artists, as well as funding the photographic services for the new models and investing in advertisement to promote our teeshare website. 

ARTICLES AND REVIEWS

      

WHAT WE DO

The concept can be summed up in three basic points:

  1. Re-elaborating a product we all love, one that has accompanied us since our very first adventures: the t-shirt;
  2. Choosing to enhance the value of the made-in-Italy concept: we work with Italian fabrics in Italian workshops and cooperatives, with communities and workers from marginalized sectors, retired people, artisans and long-standing friends;
  3. Collaborating with artists and designers, dreamers and special guests, mixing threads, sewing colors, joining ideas and sharing them by means of a t-shirt: so it’s actually more than a t-shirt, it’s “teeshare.”

Our project is also involved with ADMO (the Italian bone marrow donor association). In fact, part of our revenue from the two collections we have finished thus far was devolved to this non-profit organization. 

OUR COLLECTIONS

The two collections we have created so far:

the first was a permanent unisex line made of basic yet exclusive models, with handmade embroidery, serigraphy (the silkscreen printing process), paintings, minutias, natural materials, poems and illustrations.

   the second collection was born from an exchange of ideas with painters, photographers, designers, writers and musicians, who create their exclusive works of art on an unusual media in a limited edition, with great artistic and artisanal value.

   

THE IMPACT

We won’t be the only ones involved in all of this: the entire teeshare chain will be on board, from creation to production. Let me seize this opportunity to present them.

Who sews 

the women’s collection is made in the dress shop “L’Orlando Furioso” The workshop was originally created as an opportunity for rehabilitation and reintegration by providing vocational skills for people with mental health issues through the project “Un progetto per ricucire” (which loosely translates into “a project to mend”).

The men’s collection is made in the tailor’s shop “Il Gelso” created by eight women from different backgrounds, with the common objective of creating work opportunities in the textile and fashion sector. In 2009 it became part of Ergonauti, a social cooperative for work placement.

Who prints

“Tessuto Sociale” is a serigraphy workshop; it is part of the project “Cooperativa Terra del Fuoco-Lavoro,” which works in full respect of human dignity and workers’ rights. 

Andrea Molinatti is the freelance graphic designer who will take care of our prints in his serigraphy workshop, with his meticulous care and patience.

Sericraft is a young and motivated group specialized in serigraphy. Their handwork, their artisanal precision, and their search for constant innovations make our prints flawless.

Who embroiders

our embroidery comes to life thanks to the needle-and-thread of Francesca Bianco, a freelancer who discovered her passion for sewing and started working for the German fashion designers “Born in Berlin for fashionists.”

Liso Pasqualina and Rosa help us out with anything requiring dexterity and experience as they take care of details and fine embroidery.

Who paints

Tamara Pelà, a professional restorer, approached the world of fashion as a fashion designer for various fashion consulting agencies. She brings to teeshare her passion for painting and the precision of her fabric restoration skills.

Who tags

we want our external tags to be objects that could be re-used and collected. These labels are periodically renewed and made from different materials, and consequently prepared by different artisans and workshops. We started with “all white” because it was love at first sight. “All white” by Daniela Orlando, a ceramist and a restorer: she started by fixing broken things and then went on to making new ones in porcelain; after all, despite being made of earth, in the end porcelain is a material as precious as a jewel

A NEW EXCLUSIVE PERK

   

the "impronte" teeshares were personalized by the creative studio libelluart, serigraphed by STG. they are few in number and at a very special price.

OUR EXCLUSIVE PERKS

  

The exclusive teeshare porcelain label and the CD “Bouncing Vibes” by the band Accordi Disaccordi, the Italian Gypsy Jazz group that created the music we used in our crowdfunding video

  

a limited edition print of the photo “Cedar of Lebanon” by Silvia Pastore, featured on the homepage of the teeshare website and a 2-day stay in Turin at Casa Teeshare.

  

A thank you serigraphy certificate made by hand in a limited edition and a serigraphy workshop at the Inamorarti/Laboratorio Creativo di Torino

 

VERSIONE ITALIANA

UN PROGETTO ITALIANO CREATO SUL CONCETTO DI CONDIVISIONE

La condivisione non é per noi solo un buon proposito, ma una pratica quotidiana e di fatto la nostra caratteristica fondamentale. Abbiamo voluto che fosse chiaro sin dal principio inserendolo nel nostro marchio teeshare: “share” in inglese significa condividere, che insieme alla parola “tee” richiama la parola t-shirt, che è quello che facciamo.  

Con le nostre risorse abbiamo finanziato il lancio del progetto teeshare. Ora ti chiediamo un aiuto per sostenere parte dei costi per lo sviluppo di una nuova linea che vorremmo far uscire a Ottobre. Con il vostro supporto potremmo realizzare due nuovi modelli di teeshare, sviluppare due nuovi prototipi, coprire i costi per l’acquisto dei tessuti, creare nuove personalizzazioni anche con artisti, finanziare il servizio fotografico per i nuovi modelli, investire in pubblicità per promuovere il sito teeshare.

ARTICLES AND REVIEWS

      

COSA FACCIAMO

Il concept si puó riassumere in tre punti fondamentali:

  1. rielaborare un prodotto che amiamo, la nostra prima compagna di avventura, la t-shirt;

  2. scegliere di valorizzare il fatto in Italia: tessuti italiani, laboratori italiani, cooperative, comunità, persone, lavoratori appartenenti a fasce protette, pensionati, artigiani e amici di sempre;

  3. collaborare insieme ad artisti e designer, sognatori ed ospiti speciali, mescolare fili, cucire colori, unire le idee per condividerle grazie ad una t-shirt... anzi ”teeshare”.

Il nostro é un progetto che coinvolge l’ADMO (associazione donatori midollo osseo) a cui viene sempre devoluto parte del nostro ricavato dalle due collezioni finora terminate.

LE NOSTRE COLLEZIONI

Le due collezioni che abbiamo finora creato sono:

una permanente uomo e donna, fatta di modelli semplici ma esclusivi in cui trovano identità ricami a mano, serigrafie, dipinti, minuterie, materiali naturali, poesie e illustrazioni. 

   

La seconda, nasce dallo scambio di idee con pittori, fotografi, designer, scrittori e musicisti, diventando un nuovo supporto su cui pensare un’opera inedita, in serie limitate, di alto valore artistico e artigianale.

   

NON SIAMO SOLI

Tutto questo coinvolgerà non solo noi di teeshare, ma l'intera catena di progettazione e produzione del progetto, ve li presentiamo:

Chi cuce 

la collezione donna è prodotta dalla sartoria l’orlando furioso, la quale nasce come attività riabilitativa per l’acquisizione di competenze professionali nell’ambito della salute mentale. “Un progetto per ricucire” che ha come aree di intervento la reintegrazione delle fasce deboli.

La collezione uomo è confezionata dalla sartoria il gelso, nata per iniziativa di otto donne, provenienti da mondi diversi, con l’obiettivo di creare opportunità di lavoro nel contesto tessile e moda. Dal 2009 fa parte di ergonauti, cooperativa sociale di inserimento lavorativo.

Chi stampa

tessuto sociale, laboratorio serigrafico, è uno dei progetti della Cooperativa Terra del Fuoco-Lavoro che opera nel rispetto della dignità e dei diritti dei lavoratori.

Andrea molinatti grafico freelance e laboratorio serigrafico che si prenderà cura delle nostre stampe con minuziosa pazienza e attenzione.

sericraft gruppo giovane e motivato, specialista nella stampa serigrafica. il lavoro manuale, la precisione artigiana e lo spirito della ricerca nella continua innovazione rendono impeccabili le nostre stampe.

Chi ricama

nostri ricami prendono vita dal lavoro di francesca bianco, libera professionista la quale scopre la passione per il taglio e cucito iniziando a lavorare per le stiliste tedesche di “ Born in Berlin for fashionists”.

liso pasqualina e rosa ci aiutano in tutto ciò che ha bisogno di manualità ed esperienza nella cura dei dettagli e per i ricami a mano.

Chi dipinge

Tamara pelà, professionista restauratrice, si avvicina al mondo della moda come fashion designer per vari studi di consulenza moda, trasporta la sua passione per la pittura e la precisione del restauro su tessuto per teeshare.

Chi impasta

vogliamo che le etichette esterne siano un oggetto da riutilizzare e collezionare. Sono periodicamente rinnovate ed elaborate in diversi materiali e di conseguenza con artigiani e laboratori differenti. Iniziamo con all white perché è stato amore a prima vista. all white di daniela orlando, ceramista, restauratrice. Dall’aggiustare cose rotte, è passata a farne di nuove, in porcellana, perché nonostante sia solo terra la porcellana è un materiale prezioso come un gioiello.

UN NUOVO PREMIO

  

teeshare "impronte" personalizzate dallo studio creativo Libellulart Officina Di Segni, serigrafate da STG serigrafia tampografia grafica. pochi pezzi, ad un prezzo specialissimo.

I NOSTRI PREMI ESCLUSIVI

  

L’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare e il cd Bouncing Vibes degli Accordi Disaccordi, band italiana di Gipsy Jazz autrice del brano utilizzato nel video crowdfuning.

  

Una stampa in edizione limitata del “cedro del Libano”, pubblicata sull’home page di teeshare, by Silvia Pastore e un soggiorno di 2 giorni a Torino presso Casa Teeshare.

  

Una stampa di ringraziamento serigrafata a mano su carta in edizione limitata, ringraziamento sul sito teeshare e un workshop di serigrafia presso Inamorarti/Laboratorio Creativo di Torino

COME PUOI AIUTARCI

Se doni 5 € ricevera:

- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 1 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 10 € riceverai:

- in regalo l’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 1 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 25 € riceverai: 

- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- in regalo l’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 2 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 35 € riceverai:

- Il cd Bouncing Vibes degli Accordi Disaccordi, band italiana di Gipsy Jazz autrice del brano utilizzato nel video crowdfunding;
- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- in regalo l’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione.

Se doni 50 € riceverai: 

- in regalo una teeshare a scelta nella collezione permanente uomo/donna, costi di spedizione inclusi;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 5 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 75 € riceverai: 

- in regalo una teeshare in edizione limitata della collezione realizzata in collaborazione con gli artisti, costi di spedizione inclusi;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;

Se doni 90 €  riceverai: 

- in regalo una teeshare in edizione limitata della collezione realizzata in collaborazione con gli artisti, costi di spedizione inclusi. 
- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione.

Se doni 125 € riceverai: 

- in regalo una teeshare in edizione limitata della collezione realizzata in collaborazione con gli artisti, costi di spedizione inclusi. 
- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 20 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 175 € riceverai:

- in regalo una teeshare in edizione limitata della collezione realizzata in collaborazione con gli artisti, costi di spedizione inclusi. 
- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- Il cd Bouncing Vibes degli Accordi Disaccordi, band italiana di Gipsy Jazz autrice del brano utilizzato nel video crowdfuning;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 20 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 250 € riceverai:

- una stampa in edizione limitata del “cedro del Libano”, pubblicata sull’home page di teeshare, by Silvia Pastore;
- una teeshare in edizione limitata della collezione realizzata in collaborazione con gli artisti, costi di spedizione inclusi;
- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- Il cd Bouncing Vibes degli Accordi Disaccordi, band italiana di Gipsy Jazz autrice del brano utilizzato nel video crowdfuning;
- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 20 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 500 € riceverai: 

- soggiorno di 2 giorni a Torino presso Casa Teeshare;
- un workshop di serigrafia presso Inamorarti/Laboratorio Creativo di Torino;
- una stampa di ringraziamento serigrafata a mano su carta in edizione limitata;
- una teeshare in edizione limitata della collezione realizzata in collaborazione con gli artisti, costi di spedizione inclusi;
- 30 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;
- e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;
- 50 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Abbiamo voluto che fosse chiaro sin dal principio inserendolo nel nostro marchio teeshare: “share” in inglese significa condividere, che insieme alla parola “tee” richiama la parola t-shirt, che è quello che facciamo.  
Con le nostre risorse abbiamo finanziato il lancio del progetto teeshare. Ora ti chiediamo un aiuto per sostenere parte dei costi per lo sviluppo di una nuova linea che vorremmo far uscire a Ottobre. Con il vostro supporto potremmo realizzare due nuovi modelli di teeshare, sviluppare due nuovi prototipi, coprire i costi per l’acquisto dei tessuti, creare nuove personalizzazioni anche con artisti, finanziare il servizio fotografico per i nuovi modelli, investire in pubblicità per promuovere il sito teeshare.
ARTICLES AND REVIEWS

      

COSA FACCIAMO
Il concept si puó riassumere in tre punti fondamentali:


rielaborare un prodotto che amiamo, la nostra prima compagna di avventura, la t-shirt;


scegliere di valorizzare il fatto in Italia: tessuti italiani, laboratori italiani, cooperative, comunità, persone, lavoratori appartenenti a fasce protette, pensionati, artigiani e amici di sempre;

collaborare insieme ad artisti e designer, sognatori ed ospiti speciali, mescolare fili, cucire colori, unire le idee per condividerle grazie ad una t-shirt... anzi ”teeshare”.

Il nostro é un progetto che coinvolge l’ADMO (associazione donatori midollo osseo) a cui viene sempre devoluto parte del nostro ricavato dalle due collezioni finora terminate.
LE NOSTRE COLLEZIONI
Le due collezioni che abbiamo finora creato sono:
una permanente uomo e donna, fatta di modelli semplici ma esclusivi in cui trovano identità ricami a mano, serigrafie, dipinti, minuterie, materiali naturali, poesie e illustrazioni. 
   
La seconda, nasce dallo scambio di idee con pittori, fotografi, designer, scrittori e musicisti, diventando un nuovo supporto su cui pensare un’opera inedita, in serie limitate, di alto valore artistico e artigianale.
   


NON SIAMO SOLI
Tutto questo coinvolgerà non solo noi di teeshare, ma l'intera catena di progettazione e produzione del progetto, ve li presentiamo:
Chi cuce 
la collezione donna è prodotta dalla sartoria l’orlando furioso, la quale nasce come attività riabilitativa per l’acquisizione di competenze professionali nell’ambito della salute mentale. “Un progetto per ricucire” che ha come aree di intervento la reintegrazione delle fasce deboli.
La collezione uomo è confezionata dalla sartoria il gelso, nata per iniziativa di otto donne, provenienti da mondi diversi, con l’obiettivo di creare opportunità di lavoro nel contesto tessile e moda. Dal 2009 fa parte di ergonauti, cooperativa sociale di inserimento lavorativo.
Chi stampa
tessuto sociale, laboratorio serigrafico, è uno dei progetti della Cooperativa Terra del Fuoco-Lavoro che opera nel rispetto della dignità e dei diritti dei lavoratori. Andrea molinatti grafico freelance e laboratorio serigrafico che si prenderà cura delle nostre stampe con minuziosa pazienza e attenzione.sericraft gruppo giovane e motivato, specialista nella stampa serigrafica. il lavoro manuale, la precisione artigiana e lo spirito della ricerca nella continua innovazione rendono impeccabili le nostre stampe.
Chi ricama
nostri ricami prendono vita dal lavoro di francesca bianco, libera professionista la quale scopre la passione per il taglio e cucito iniziando a lavorare per le stiliste tedesche di “ Born in Berlin for fashionists”.
liso pasqualina e rosa ci aiutano in tutto ciò che ha bisogno di manualità ed esperienza nella cura dei dettagli e per i ricami a mano.
Chi dipinge
Tamara pelà, professionista restauratrice, si avvicina al mondo della moda come fashion designer per vari studi di consulenza moda, trasporta la sua passione per la pittura e la precisione del restauro su tessuto per teeshare.

Chi impasta

vogliamo che le etichette esterne siano un oggetto da riutilizzare e collezionare. Sono periodicamente rinnovate ed elaborate in diversi materiali e di conseguenza con artigiani e laboratori differenti. Iniziamo con all white perché è stato amore a prima vista. all white di daniela orlando, ceramista, restauratrice. Dall’aggiustare cose rotte, è passata a farne di nuove, in porcellana, perché nonostante sia solo terra la porcellana è un materiale prezioso come un gioiello.



UN NUOVO PREMIO
  
teeshare "impronte" personalizzate dallo studio creativo Libellulart Officina Di Segni, serigrafate da STG serigrafia tampografia grafica. pochi pezzi, ad un prezzo specialissimo.
I NOSTRI PREMI ESCLUSIVI
  
L’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare e il cd Bouncing Vibes degli Accordi Disaccordi, band italiana di Gipsy Jazz autrice del brano utilizzato nel video crowdfuning.
  
Una stampa in edizione limitata del “cedro del Libano”, pubblicata sull’home page di teeshare, by Silvia Pastore e un soggiorno di 2 giorni a Torino presso Casa Teeshare.
  
Una stampa di ringraziamento serigrafata a mano su carta in edizione limitata, ringraziamento sul sito teeshare e un workshop di serigrafia presso Inamorarti/Laboratorio Creativo di Torino
COME PUOI AIUTARCI
Se doni 5 € ricevera:- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;- 1 € verrà donato all’Admo.
Se doni 10 € riceverai:
- in regalo l’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare;- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;- 1 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 25 € riceverai: 

- 20 % di sconto valido per sei mesi per l’acquisto di un qualsiasi prodotto sul e-shop di teeshare;- in regalo l’esclusiva etichetta in porcellana di teeshare;- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;- 2 € verrà donato all’Admo.

- in regalo una teeshare a scelta nella collezione permanente uomo/donna, costi di spedizione inclusi;- ringraziamento sul sito di teeshare, link a un vostro eventuale sito o blog e e-mail di aggiornamento sullo sviluppo della nuova collezione;- 5 € verrà donato all’Admo.

Se doni 90 €  riceverai:

story:
Our story

After decades of battling the millions of lost Bobby pins, the solution is finally here. We are proud to present to you the world's best Bobby pin container.

We are a brother, sister and father who came up with this amazing idea. In our family the women have always been big consumers of Bobby pins and disorganized at the same time. Therefore the need for a simple way to storage Bobby pins whenever they were on-the-go, was always present.

So one afternoon, on a hot summer day in our little white house the idea started. And as a tribute to where the idea originated, we named the company Casa Blanca Denmark. 


Development

The brainstorming has taken us far and it has been an exciting journey to get to where we are today.

The first idea was a small regtangular case, that looked something like this:

Bad idea.

The next development, was changing the shape to a cylinder to make it easier to bring with you.

This was the first stage of the Casa Blanca Bobby Pin Container.

For the usability a twist-up effect was added to give easier access to the Bobby pins. 


Finally, to keep the Bobby pins in place, a magnet was added inside the container. 


And here is the final Casa Blanca Bobby pin container:


The container is practical and easy to use yet elegantly designed with a touch of scandinavian simplicity. The magnet ensures that the Bobby pins stays in place.

We need your help

While spending the family funds on product development and samples, we are now ready to place the first order, and that's why we need your help. To place the minimum order, we need our pledged goal of $4.000, therefore our business depends on your fundings. Any further contributions will be spent on the following: 

  • Stretch goal $7.000: Marketing
  • Stretch goal $10.000: Travel expenses (Fairs, distributor meetings, etc.)
  • Stretch goal $13.000: New designs of the Casa Blanca Bobby pin container


Eventhough you aren't a Bobby pin user yourself, you probably know someone who is. From speaking with friends and family we can conclude that many women will find a Bobby pin container very useful. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Hopefully, you will find this project interesting. If you do, please help us by sharing it with your network. Also, feel free to like our facebook page for updates in the process, and ask your friends to do the same. 


Founders, retailers and others, if you have any questions do not hesitate to contact us via Facebook or e-mail.

E-mail: Info@casablancadenmark.com

story:
Hello family and friends! 

We are humbly and graciously asking for your support in order to help us take the next step in our business journey.  We have been invited back to present our Hey Jude collection at Vancouver Eco Fashion Week this October and due to a close deadline and a big company step in renting our own work studio this Summer, we really need some help! 

Having had presented and learned a great deal from last seasons experience, we are incredibly excited at the opportunity to flex our creative muscles once more and show the city of Vancouver (and beyond) what we are made of. Having impressed so many with our presentation last season we feel that taking the step to present for a consecutive season where we can maximize on the industries anticipation to "see what we do next," is a really smart step for Hey Jude to take. 

We would like to ask without any pressure or expectation for you to make a donation to purchase one of our packages and in return we will pass along some awesome perks/gift cards and a great big thank you SO much! If you are unable to, we completely understand and just ask that you send some some positive vibes and energy our way! Oh, and we'd still love to see you rooting us on at our show! 


What We Need & What You Get

Okay, so here is the nitty gritty...

To participate at these events it costs a lot of money. (For example; we were approached to present this fall at LA Fashion week which would have cost us up to 18k). In return they provide you with most of the organizing, personal backstage, a phenomenal venue, guaranteed press and promotion, a publicist, showroom manager  and the opportunity to propel your brand into being known by the general public (which then translates into followers and buyers for your brand). We passed on LA Fashion Week for this season having really mulling and weighing the pros and cons and coming to the conclusion that we still have more to grow within our own city before we take over North America (and hey, it's going to happen!). We really believe that we've created a strong foundation for our business and we are on the brink of our tipping point for when our dream becomes our livelihood. 

The $3000 we are hoping to raise through this campaign will be added to our profits from a one night shop + social event we are going to host at our studio before Eco Fashion Week and will hopefully allow us to successfully present our best collection yet for Eco Fashion Week. 


What we need the money for:

- Participation Fee (this covers all the staging and lighting, professional models, professional hair and make-up teams, runway production, designer seminars, promotion and press, a publisist and a showroom manager to show our brand to buyers).

- Promotion Costs (photo shoot of our product styling with a professional photographer, model and make-up artist and printing promotional materials to be put on the seats at our show).

- Clothing (2+ buying trips to get our pieces for the show. Our buying trips include us waking up at 6am to hit the road for a 12-14+ hour day of driving and hunting.)

- Extra Costs (buying shoes and accessories to be used for our show, music, undergarments and styling supplies, etc.)

What do we do if we have some extra money? 

Well, it could happen. And if that's the case, we want to up front and honest so you can trust what we're doing with our donations. If we exceed our goal and have a little bit of extra dough we will be using that to directly fund our next pop-up shop that is scheduled to take place in late October/November. We are going to host our best shop yet and really want to focus on finding a prime location this time around in a high traffic area! But as you know; the better the real estate the higher the cost. 

Are you wondering why we don't have the money already? Do our clothes sell? Is this a smart investment? 

Well, here's the hard numbers...

For us to host a pop-up shop it costs $2500-$6000 depending on location, decor, promotional costs and how much product we need to buy. We've had 5 pop-ups to date. Up until this point we have sold over $30,000 worth of vintage clothing and have reinvested every penny back into our business. This means our business has steadily and organically grown DEBT FREE. We have a good amount of product in inventory, company supplies (hello $300 steamers!), pop-up decor, an incredible collection of photos from creative shoots and an amazing following of customers! We know eventually to take it to the next level we will need to take out a loan or get an investor but for now we'd really like to invite our family and friends to be apart of our success and help us stretch a little farther before we need to take it to that point. 

The Impact

This time around with our gained knowledge/wisdom of how this event works; we are really excited to take full advantage of what this opportunity can do for Hey Jude. Having already received press in The Province, Georgia Straight, Metro News, Scout Magazine, Global TV and New York based magazines Suitcase and SHK, we are looking to grow our media exposure with our presentation and will be sending out a press release to all Canadian based fashion magazines. As well, we are looking to take this opportunity to promote (for the first time at a event), our new online store and upcoming pop-up shop that will be this Fall featuring a large collection of what you will preview on the runway. Having never had such a large outlet to promote these events for ourselves and it is going to be extremely beneficial for us. 

We also can't let you know our bit about the impact without mentioning the environment. Honestly, we didn't initially make the decision to have a company based on vintage clothing because of the environmental impact it had. But having being educated in the matter since and really taking an interest in it, we are extremely proud of the fact that we have chosen a greener way to dress ourselves and you.  A few reasons why we are so passionate about not contributing to "fast fashion" (this is all the mass produced, high volume garments that are made for next to nothing and sold by all the giant retailers) is because it is extremely harmful to the environment, causes air pollution, depletes water resources, increases the use of harmful chemicals and increases our oil use. The average person throws away 68 pounds of clothing a year. When you multiply that by how many people are in your city it becomes a serious number. We are passionate about being on the other side of that fight by recycling, reusing and choosing to be eco-conscious in our purchases and practices. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from your donations (in exchange for some fun gifts and GCs of course!), we accept: positive energy, salt & vinegar chips (essential during our long prepping hours), good blessings & prayers, you telling all your friends about Hey Jude and inviting them  to our events and just a good old like or comment on our social media to reassure us that we haven't annoyed you with our posting just yet. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this! 

If you know anyone who you think would be interested in seeing our campaign please share!

xox

Lauren + Lyndsey

story:
This Campaign has been already ended.

You Can Visit our Website for more Updates;

www.iLoveProudCowboys.com

The Inspiration Behind Pixie Splitz....

   Almost every child seems to go through a difficult phase of learning to put shoes on the correct feet. I have worked at a child development center for the past 6 years, and have observed this dilemma among young children. Children like to be independent, therefore this causes frustration.This can be time consuming for parents and caretakers of little independents! :) I began to observe closer when the children would choose a shoe, it was simply a guessing game! There is no indication from a child's viewpoint to have the cognitive ability for order when putting on shoes! Shoes are not kid friendly! 

   Putting shoes on with the Split Image Indication Technique

  

It does not really matter how much time, money, and effort is spent on the design and structure of a shoe if it never makes it to the correct foot! Children love being independent! Shoes should be fun and exciting! This is why I have created Pixie Splitz! These are insole inserts for children that have split images on them to indicate the order for children! An effective, yet simple, two piece puzzle!!

 

Pixie Splitz Designs

The inserts are being launched on Indiegogo in six colorful and exciting images! Each insert will be printed on 3mm white neoprene. This is a thin material used for wetsuits, koozies, laptop sleeves,etc...I selected neoprene because it can be water resistant and withstand fluctuated temperature levels. It is thin enough to fit in the bottom of a child's shoe, yet a smooth surface for comfort. Each footprint will be 6" long and 3" wide, with a half inch of white neoprene on each side, resulting in approximately a 7"x7" dimension. The inserts will be easy to use and beneficial! (recommended for children ages 1-6 yrs old)

Directions...

1. Place insert on a hard surface

2. Have child stand on footprints ( or use existing shoes insoles)

3. Use a pen or marker to trace around each foot (or insoles) for desired measurements

4. Have child step off inserts. Then trim inserts to size

5. Place inserts in shoes!

 

Successful Split Imaging Zebra!

It's time to stop the confusion! Help me on my journey to revolutionize the way children are being introduced to shoes! We can make a difference, but I need your help! :) The initial order is 5,000 inserts, that's several children, and I'm excited to reach out to others with Pixie Splitz! So PLEASE help me get started!

 

 

Risks and challenges

I am in the process of setting up an online store offering Pixie Splitz, but you have the opportunity of being the first in helping me revolutionize the way we can market children's shoes! The industry is overlooking how an insole can be benificial to children. Imaging on most children's shoes currently have mirrored imaging. This is cute, but what advantage does it create for children? My goal is to work with leading shoe manufacturers and start a split image indication printing system. This way split images can be directly printed in the insoles of children's shoes. It is a new and exciting way to market children's shoes, yet beneficial to the ones wearing them--CHILDREN!! :)
story_txt:
The Inspiration Behind Pixie Splitz....
   Almost every child seems to go through a difficult phase of learning to put shoes on the correct feet. I have worked at a child development center for the past 6 years, and have observed this dilemma among young children. Children like to be independent, therefore this causes frustration.This can be time consuming for parents and caretakers of little independents! :) I began to observe closer when the children would choose a shoe, it was simply a guessing game! There is no indication from a child's viewpoint to have the cognitive ability for order when putting on shoes! Shoes are not kid friendly! 

   Putting shoes on with the Split Image Indication Technique
  
It does not really matter how much time, money, and effort is spent on the design and structure of a shoe if it never makes it to the correct foot! Children love being independent! Shoes should be fun and exciting! This is why I have created Pixie Splitz! These are insole inserts for children that have split images on them to indicate the order for children! An effective, yet simple, two piece puzzle!!
 

Pixie Splitz Designs
The inserts are being launched on Indiegogo in six colorful and exciting images! Each insert will be printed on 3mm white neoprene. This is a thin material used for wetsuits, koozies, laptop sleeves,etc...I selected neoprene because it can be water resistant and withstand fluctuated temperature levels. It is thin enough to fit in the bottom of a child's shoe, yet a smooth surface for comfort. Each footprint will be 6" long and 3" wide, with a half inch of white neoprene on each side, resulting in approximately a 7"x7" dimension. The inserts will be easy to use and beneficial! (recommended for children ages 1-6 yrs old)
Directions...
1. Place insert on a hard surface
2. Have child stand on footprints ( or use existing shoes insoles)
3. Use a pen or marker to trace around each foot (or insoles) for desired measurements
4. Have child step off inserts. Then trim inserts to size
5. Place inserts in shoes!
 

Successful Split Imaging Zebra!
It's time to stop the confusion! Help me on my journey to revolutionize the way children are being introduced to shoes! We can make a difference, but I need your help! :) The initial order is 5,000 inserts, that's several children, and I'm excited to reach out to others with Pixie Splitz! So PLEASE help me get started!
 
 

Risks and challenges
I am in the process of setting up an online store offering Pixie Splitz, but you have the opportunity of being the first in helping me revolutionize the way we can market children's shoes! The industry is overlooking how an insole can be benificial to children. Imaging on most children's shoes currently have mirrored imaging. This is cute, but what advantage does it create for children? My goal is to work with leading shoe manufacturers and start a split image indication printing system. This way split images can be directly printed in the insoles of children's shoes. It is a new and exciting way to market children's shoes, yet beneficial to the ones wearing them--CHILDREN!! :)

story:
What is a Beach Buggy?

A beach buggy is a fun, reasonably cheap-to-build kit car that just makes everyone feel happy.

I can remember when this was a rusty, dirty old chassis like mine is now. That was four years ago.

I hope you'll share this journey with me and be part of the adventure by supporting me. Any donation, big or small, will be greatly appreciated and put to good use : ) I will also be pleased to acknowledge it thoughtfully. I have already saved up over $200 from birthdays etc which I've used to buy the donor tunnel, beam/transaxle and tools.

I am raising money for two new floorpan halves. This will cost $500. The floorpan and the tunnel are the base for the entire car and together they make the chassis. 

To follow this project go to www.manxbuild.com

I would really appreciate it if you could spread the word of my build and visit my website.

story:
NEW PERK:

Hats Off to our Vets! Say thank you to a Veteran by giving them a sweet lid and get yourself one for doing so.  Now that's a win-win! 




LIFT23 featured in Hackers Paradise     

"After several rounds and countless hours on the range it can confidently be said that the company’s claims are legit."

Playing sports doesn't have to mean sweaty, smelly, blistering feet.  The most comfortable, moisture-wicking, high performance athletic sock you have been wishing and waiting for has arrived.  But by discovering LIFT23's new athletic socks, you will do more than just improve your round, your run, your game.  You will help share the joy of sports with returning Veterans who have served our country.  

        

          

Let me explain.  LIFT23 is gearing up to roll out our newest sock—a low rise athletic sock that can be used for a variety of activities such as golfing,  running, tennis, and cycling.  And we are very excited to be teaming up with the amazing PGA HOPE (Helping Our Patriots Everywhere) as our beneficiary. For every pair of these LIFT23 socks purchased, we alternate between donating a pair of socks to a Veteran recovering in a VA hospital, and donating a portion of our profits to PGA HOPE.  PGA HOPE is a proven program that partners with VA hospitals and uses golf as an activity to both assist veterans with their progress in rehab and help them assimilate back into their community through the social interaction the game provides.  

Even if you are short on time, I hope you will check out the video above, where you will hear Marine Corporal Chris Nowak tell you from the heart the impact PGA HOPE has on Veterans, and how excited he and the program are to be joining forces with LIFT23. 

SOUNDS GOOD, BUT WHAT'S SO SPECIAL ABOUT LIFT23's SOCKS?

Glad you asked.  

These are not the cotton or polyester socks you buy in 3-packs for 10 bucks.

LIFT23 socks are performance socks designed to keep your feet super dry and extremely comfortable when you are out breaking a sweat.  Our socks use a proprietary merino wool blend designed to wick away moisture, keeping your feet comfortable and dry in all climates. Naturally antimicrobial, these socks will not stink!  Our socks have a no-rub seam at the toe and added compression in the arch that ensures your socks don't slip, even during the most rigorous of activities. You will notice a difference in feel both when you put on the socks and eventually take them off (although you are not going to want to). Did I mention they come in both traditional and non-traditional colors and look damn nice? 


Tested and reviewed by:

"I was given a pair of LIFT23 golf socks to try out. I have since replaced my sock drawer with LIFT23s.  You won't find a better sock" - Jason Peterson (PGA Professional)

"Other than when I'm on the ropes, these are my go to socks when competing." 

Pete Mongeau (Crossfit Competitor) 

"Super impressed with how dry my feet were after the race"

-John Buzanga (competitive cyclist)

WHY MERINO? 

"Wool fiber has a higher vapor moisture absorbency than other natural fibers, such as cotton, linen, and silk, and general synthetic fibers. It also has higher heat releasing and heat absorption properties accompanying moisture absorption and desorption respectively, which strengthens the buffering effect of the clothing between the human body and the surrounding environment."

- Liya Zhou Polytechnic University, Hong Kong; Xunwei Feng and Yan     feng  Du
The College of Textiles, DongHua University, Shanghai, China; Yi Li The Institute of Textile and Clothing, Hong Kong Polytechnic University, Hong Kong, China

Don't synthetics do the job just as well?

  • Scientific tests carried out by the Hohenstein Institute in Germany, the Ergonomics Unit at the Polytechnic Institute of Wales, and the CSIRO in Australia support anecdotal evidence that Superfine Merino provides the wearer with superior overall climate control and moisture absorption than synthetics. 
  • Studies have also confirmed that merino offers higher natural UV protection than many other fibers including cotton.

Merino wool is well-known for keeping you warm in the cold, but less well known as the ideal fabric for keeping you dry and cool in hot weather

  • The Bedouin tribes of the Sinai, where temperatures reach extreme highs, have been wrapping themselves in wool for centuries. 
  • The merino wool works as a condition buffer; in the heat cooling the body initially through managing the build up of moisture vapor internally, keeping the wearer drier for longer. 
  • Then, by not clinging to the skin even when wet, the fabric allows the skin to continue to do its job through sweating and cooling the body.

WHY THE NEW SOCKS?  AND WHY AND HOW DID THE PARTNERSHIP WITH PGA HOPE COME ABOUT?    

The great feedback we received about our ski socks made us realize that people who engage in all type of athletics should have the benefit of LIFT23 socks.  And with more people wearing our socks, we knew we could make a bigger impact.   

Once we heard about PGA HOPE, we knew right away that we wanted this amazing program to be the beneficiary of our low rise athletic socks.  We had a whirlwind of meetings, and a partnership was born.   After brainstorming, PGA HOPE and LIFT23 agreed that we could best serve the Veterans as follows:  for every pair of these socks purchased, LIFT23 will alternate between donating a pair of socks to a Veteran recovering in a VA hospital, and donating a portion of our profits to PGA HOPE. 

TELL ME MORE ABOUT PGA HOPE AND THE PEOPLE IT SERVES 

PGA HOPE (Helping Our Patriots Everywhere) is a year- round golf program for all military Veterans, designed to enhance their rehabilitation and assimilation back into society. The HOPE program provides all Veterans with FREE golf instruction taught by local PGA Professionals.  As Chris explains in the video above, golf gives these men and women something else to focus on besides their daily mental and physical rehabilitation.  

Quick Facts

  • There are more than 3 million disabled veterans in the U.S.
  • Over 300,000 active duty military have returned from Iraq, Afghanistan and other current conflicts with some form of disability 
  • Suicide is a major issue among military veterans; recent studies showing that 5000 to 8000 Veterans commit suicide each year (22 suicides a day)


We need your help!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

  • You can get socks (at a discounted price) and/or other cool stuff in return for your contributions by selecting a perk listed at the top right-hand corner of this page. (See FAQs below regarding choosing sizes)

  • Your pledge at any level will have a dramatic effect not only on your feet, but in lifting the spirits of our Veterans (See Stretch Goals below)
  • Regardless of whether you contribute financially, you can help the campaign tremendously by spreading the word about it to friends who might be interested in LIFT23 socks and its mission.    

FAQ's

What sizes do LIFT23s come in? How do I choose which socks to order?

 We will email you an order form for you to choose colors and sizes shortly after receiving your "perk" purchase.  Size and color options are:  

White w/Navy - fits Men's shoe sizes 9-12, Women's 10+


Black w/White - fits Men's shoe sizes 9-12, Women's 10+

      White w/Grey - fits Men's shoe sizes 9-12, Women's 10+

White w/Orange - fits Women's shoe sizes 6-10, Men's 5-8.5

Black w/Grey - fits Women's shoe sizes 6-10, Men's 5-8.5

Women's White w/Green - fits shoe sizes 3.5-5.5

Your socks sound and look great, but I don't play golf.  Can I wear them for anything else?

Of course!  Once you put our socks on your feet, you won't want to take them off. Regardless of whether you golf, you will want to wear these socks for comfort in your everyday activities.  Not to mention that they look pretty cool too.  

What is LIFT23?    

LIFT23 is a premium athletic sock company equally committed to offering performance-enhancing socks and lifting the spirits of those in need. For every pair of socks purchased, we give back to a designated cause by means of donated socks, money, or both.  Featured in/on:


Do you ship internationally? 

Yes! Recently reduced!!  Add $10 to your order for international shipping.

How will you be delivering the socks to Veterans?  

 Ed Del Guercio and Chris Nowak will make every effort to personally deliver the socks.  We have designed  special packaging and have arranged to include with the socks written thank yous from schoolchildren who have taken the time to think about what our Veterans have done and continue to do for them.  


                                             

Do the Veterans get the same socks as we purchase?

We are not trying to "pull the wool" over anyone's eyes. The fact is, wool is an expensive fiber.  Out donated socks are made up of our own cotton blend that is super comfortable, durable, and yes, look damn nice.

                                        

                

           Want to sell LIFT23s in your store?

                  Super! Just click on the button below to email us with your info.

                                                                   SELL LIFT23


          LIFT23 Founder Ed Del Guercio and PGA HOPE Coordinator Chris Nowak

story:
Anyone who's ever had the pleasure of bathing a baby, or more so toddler, knows what a stressful challenge it can be.  Not only stressful for you, but a situation that poses great risk to the baby or toddler's safety.  One night, my girlfriend was bathing our son in the kitchen sink.  He's a wild, fun little boy who, without fail, gets a little overexcited during bath time.  We were always stressing because he has gotten hurt before and has had so many near-accidents, whether it be in the sink or a tub.  This was my eureka moment -- why not adapt a seat for babies/toddlers to be harnessed in so we can alleviate these concerns. 

I did my research and found that there are a variety of products available for bathing, but not quite what I had in mind.  Nonetheless, I checked them out and the reviews don't lie.  There are a number of design flaws and cheap components that make those very products no safer than the alternative.  The bath seat I've been developing is unlike others in the marketplace. The design and features make it more stabilized, safer, aesthetic in addition to being simple for the bather.  This is key in creating a safe bathing environment.   Not having to worry so much about the potential for injury, and flailing around, will undoubtedly make the "bath time" experience something to look forward to, not dread. 

Prototyping is the next phase of the development process.  This is costly, but worthwhile.  Prototyping will enable myself and others involved in the development process to refine the design so that the seat is as safe, comfortable, aesthetic, and functional as possible.  The funds raised will all go to prototyping and help pave the way for me to bring SnappySeat to production.

story:
The Comfort Touch series gives you additional comfort and heat via an ultra soft & reliable conductive fibre. The heating areas are completely sewn into the fabrics. Unlike traditional heat garment, you won’t be able to feel the uncomfortable wire, it’s the detail part where we care about you.

Experience our discreet and unique sewing process. Comfort Touch combines classic wool with innovative knitting technology. Our scarves are woven with a Completely sewn-in heating panel, powered by a tailor-made InLab matchbox-sized rechargeable battery. Charge the battery, then tuck it inside the scarf's little built-in pouch that only you will know. There are no wires or cables showing, nor anything for you to worry about. Everything about our design is safe, soft, and easy to use.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

What's more indispensable than a scarf in any winter wardrobe? A high-technology heating scarf can be worn indoor and out. Keep snug and banish those winter winds and chills. Our intention was to combine BREAKTHROUGH SMART technology into a contemporary design, and offer you top quality in terms of durability, comfort and style. We've invested numerous hours transforming our inspiration into a working, beautiful product that's been thoroughly tested for the best materials and functionality, at the best prices. The InLab Design team have sweated long and hard, because we believe the extra effort is what makes our product a true inspiration.

Through our very first product launch, InLab would like to achieve our mission that is to create a brand and offer products to bring each of you a healthier yet smarter lifestyle.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get 

 

 

InLab Design is an innovative lifestyle brand that marries technology and design. Our mission is to inspire a dynamic, happy and active lifestyle. We are also striving in becoming one of the key player in the cutting-edge wearable, Smart clothing. It is the kind of apparel that has implemented electronic parts, in particular, microcomputers and sensors. It’s worn as ordinary clothing, providing additional value to the user by virtue of innovative technologies. Our dedicated team includes a product designer, engineer, writer, project manager, and a sport-loving CEO.

Our founders, Diana and Tak are technology-driven enthusiasts always on the lookout experimenting and creating what's versatile and essential to improve our everyday lives. Together, we’ve created Comfort Touch at InLab Design, an innovative line of apparel to enhance the quality of your life.

Our team of diverse individuals offers years of combined experience and expertise in design, engineering, project execution and manufacturing. We stand behind one single objective - to redefine the most essential winter accessories at affordable prices. Comfort Touch scarf is just the beginning. Share and enjoy our journey of exciting dream of innovative products today by backing our team.

WE ARE IN PRODUCTION STAGE

WHY COMFORT TOUCH- InLab Design

 

CHOICE- We offer an unmatched breadth of innovative products, spanning styles and price points

INNOVATION- Designed to fit your life: Leading edge technology & designmeets easy to use experience

BRAND- We stand for comfort, quality & lifestyle: We make every lifestyle comes with fun(ctionality)

"InLabDesign is the private gear I have created for people I love & myself", Diana Yiu.

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Challenges 

When the Idea Come Out
Our R&D team has dedicated more than 12 months to test and research garment textiles. We focussed on features we thought are the most important for consumers of wearable tech designs: softness, heating property, flexibility, safety and durability. We've rigorously conducted over 3000 tests in order to discover and analyze for the best results. 

Reliable and Sustainable 
We understand and care about the importance of safety and the need for strict regulation compliance. That's why every single material and component in our product have been specially selected and tested, again and again so you can wear with comfort and assurance. 

Schedule Timing and Potential Risks 
Our team has put in place a solid schedule and execution plan to bring the Comfort Touch Scarf to market. Our team is experienced in dealing with production, technical issue, and delivery arrangement etc. We've also imagined possible scenarios and created contingency plans.

 

Staying Curious

New technology is fascinating. We believe technology is a tool that is meant to simplify our everyday lives and make us smarter and healthier. If you can think of any questions about our product that's not already covered in the FAQ, pose it to our team. We will respond to your inquiries as soon as we can. 

Share, explore and experience our unique InLab Design innovations. And yes, we strongly appreciate and need your support to fund our campaign.
story_txt:
The Comfort Touch series gives you additional comfort and heat via an ultra soft & reliable conductive fibre. The heating areas are completely sewn into the fabrics. Unlike traditional heat garment, you won’t be able to feel the uncomfortable wire, it’s the detail part where we care about you.
Experience our discreet and unique sewing process. Comfort Touch combines classic wool with innovative knitting technology. Our scarves are woven with a Completely sewn-in heating panel, powered by a tailor-made InLab matchbox-sized rechargeable battery. Charge the battery, then tuck it inside the scarf's little built-in pouch that only you will know. There are no wires or cables showing, nor anything for you to worry about. Everything about our design is safe, soft, and easy to use.
 
 

 

 
 
 

 
 
 

What's more indispensable than a scarf in any winter wardrobe? A high-technology heating scarf can be worn indoor and out. Keep snug and banish those winter winds and chills. Our intention was to combine BREAKTHROUGH SMART technology into a contemporary design, and offer you top quality in terms of durability, comfort and style. We've invested numerous hours transforming our inspiration into a working, beautiful product that's been thoroughly tested for the best materials and functionality, at the best prices. The InLab Design team have sweated long and hard, because we believe the extra effort is what makes our product a true inspiration.
Through our very first product launch, InLab would like to achieve our mission that is to create a brand and offer products to bring each of you a healthier yet smarter lifestyle.

 
 

What We Need & What You Get 


 
 

InLab Design is an innovative lifestyle brand that marries technology and design. Our mission is to inspire a dynamic, happy and active lifestyle. We are also striving in becoming one of the key player in the cutting-edge wearable, Smart clothing. It is the kind of apparel that has implemented electronic parts, in particular, microcomputers and sensors. It’s worn as ordinary clothing, providing additional value to the user by virtue of innovative technologies. Our dedicated team includes a product designer, engineer, writer, project manager, and a sport-loving CEO.
Our founders, Diana and Tak are technology-driven enthusiasts always on the lookout experimenting and creating what's versatile and essential to improve our everyday lives. Together, we’ve created Comfort Touch at InLab Design, an innovative line of apparel to enhance the quality of your life.
Our team of diverse individuals offers years of combined experience and expertise in design, engineering, project execution and manufacturing. We stand behind one single objective - to redefine the most essential winter accessories at affordable prices. Comfort Touch scarf is just the beginning. Share and enjoy our journey of exciting dream of innovative products today by backing our team.
WE ARE IN PRODUCTION STAGE


WHY COMFORT TOUCH- InLab Design
 
CHOICE- We offer an unmatched breadth of innovative products, spanning styles and price points
INNOVATION- Designed to fit your life: Leading edge technology & designmeets easy to use experience
BRAND- We stand for comfort, quality & lifestyle: We make every lifestyle comes with fun(ctionality)
"InLabDesign is the private gear I have created for people I love & myself", Diana Yiu.

 
 

 
Risks and challenges
Challenges When the Idea Come OutOur R&D team has dedicated more than 12 months to test and research garment textiles. We focussed on features we thought are the most important for consumers of wearable tech designs: softness, heating property, flexibility, safety and durability. We've rigorously conducted over 3000 tests in order to discover and analyze for the best results. Reliable and Sustainable We understand and care about the importance of safety and the need for strict regulation compliance. That's why every single material and component in our product have been specially selected and tested, again and again so you can wear with comfort and assurance. Schedule Timing and Potential Risks Our team has put in place a solid schedule and execution plan to bring the Comfort Touch Scarf to market. Our team is experienced in dealing with production, technical issue, and delivery arrangement etc. We've also imagined possible scenarios and created contingency plans.

 
Staying Curious
New technology is fascinating. We believe technology is a tool that is meant to simplify our everyday lives and make us smarter and healthier. If you can think of any questions about our product that's not already covered in the FAQ, pose it to our team. We will respond to your inquiries as soon as we can. 
Share, explore and experience our unique InLab Design innovations. And yes, we strongly appreciate and need your support to fund our campaign.

story:
Time – Space Continuum & the Final Frontier

Based on the general and special theories of relativity, time dilation can be caused by the speed and gravity. 

In the past few decades, many Velocity and Gravitational time dilation tests were completed & have proven that the possibility of time travel.  

For instance：Theoretically, if travelling by 99.99999% of speed of light, it takes less than 6 months to Year AD3000 ( Now the fastest speed of space ship is 0.01% of speed of light)   

 

Can mankind travel through time and space?

 

A True Story Behind Ground Breaking Innovation

Inspired by the 'true story' of Time machine which happened in Venice, Italy in 1950's, today a new watch brand 'Chronovisor' is created by our professionals who have been working for long years in horology industry. 

A time travel device which consists of a screen and tuning-dials, is known as a "Chronovisor" and while it does not let a person “step into” history, it displays the sound and image so the user can “view” a window into the past. Chronovisor was built by Pellegrino Ernetti (1925–1994), an Italian priest and scientist, with a team which included twelve world-famous scientists. 

Today the alleged existence of the Time machine, Chronovisor was seized and is actually used by the Vatican or by those who secretly control governments and their economies all around the world.

 

 Chronovisor, the Ultimate Time Traveler

 

                                                            www.chronovisor.ch

                       

 

The Concept of Chronovisor  

We believe in the combination of traditional craftsmanship and advanced technology, a crossover of modern and antiquated times. And applying them on a creation of horological timepiece. 

 

Our GOAL    

Our Chronovisor team was originally from different watch companies, including the Swiss group of famous brands and localized small business. We have 5-15 years of working experience with various departments, such as 'Research & Development', 'Sales & Marketing', ' Product quality control' and ' After-sales service'. 

We are enthusiastic watchmakers & passionate about the craftsmanship of horological timepiece. We believe that good creativity and craftsmanship should not be constrained by the high cost or monopoly of large groups. 

Therefore, our team is committed to producing an innovative, high-quality and high-grade timepiece pricing at reasonable & affordable level. We are pleased to bring Chronovisor to a life on Indiegogo. 

 

                                                           

                             www.chronovisor.ch

 

 

Specification

 

Movement

·       Automatic caliber Miyota 8218 

Functions

·       3 self-powered gas tubes on hour, minute for night reading capability (6.0 x 3.35 rectangular x 1  , 0.5 x 1.6 cylindrical x 1,  0.5 x 2.4 cylindrical x 1)

·       Inner bezel with super luminova paint 

·       Hours, minutes, small seconds and date

Water Resistance 

·       100m 

Case

·       Titanium case

·       Diamond like carbon coating  

·       Ceramic bezel

·       Diameter 43mm, height 12.35mm

·       Anti-reflective sapphire crystal

·       Sapphire crystal case back

·       Screwed-in crown 

Band

·       NBR rubber strap with standard buckle

Dial

·       Black 

 

Chronovisor. The Best Time Companion Through Time

 

Chronovisor aims to develop an unique watch brand and continue with this direction in a long run. We believe the success factor of all famous brands is not about their long history, but entirely depends on its great work of brand beliefs, product design, quality control & customer service.      

Our team has spent almost one year for the invention of Chronovisor CVNM6102 - an innovative timepiece which is 100% qualified for night reading capability in the darkest time, even for your journey to the galaxy in the future. 

 

 

Collection

 

Packing & Accessories

USB flash drive 16GB memory & installed with CVNM6102 user manual

 

Team description 

Product design, Technical development, Quality management by Swiss team located in Neuchâtel, Switzerland.

Manufacturing & Assembly by Hong Kong team

 

Thank You

FAQ 

1) Why Chronovisor? 

To Chronovisor team, it is not only an Indiegogo project but always a legend of brand building. Our goal is to build an excellent timepiece by our experienced professionals & offer to end customer at affordable price. All Chronovisor products are creative, durable & at highest quality standards. We stand firmly by our brand beliefs & always provide the best after- sales service. 

2) What size is the watch? 

The case diameter is 43mm & the thickness is 12.35mm 

3) What is the watch movement?

Chronovisor is set with Miyota 8218 automatic movement. It is small second function, 21,600 vibrations per hour and power reserved to 40+ hours. Miyota 8218 is a renowned automatic movement.

4) Is it see through case back?

Yes! It is open back design. Also sapphire crystal is used on case back for the best quality.

5) Why use titanium case?

Due largely to its rarity, Titanium is generally more expensive than other types of metals like steel, aluminium , iron...It is a kind of material which is hypoallergenic, non-magnetisable & natural resistance to rust and corrosion. Titanium is among the strongest and most durable metals on the planet. It has the highest strength-to-density ratio of any metallic element on the periodic table. Each Chronovisor CVNM6102 is equipped with Titanium case, in order to meet the highest standard of quality. 

6) What is the Super-LumiNova painting? 

Super-LumiNova is a kind of luminescent material. It is deposited on the inner bezel of Chronovisor CVNM6102, in order to read the indications in the obscurity. In general, this light emission is of photo luminescent (resulting from the absorption of light) Super-LumiNova is non-radioactive photoluminescent pigment. Its luminescence decreases with hours but it is restored as soon as the watch is exposed to bright light. As an average, Super-LumiNova can glow for approximately 8-10 hours at night. 

7) Is it screwed in crown?

All Chronovisor timepieces are engineered with screwed in crowns. For watch adjustment, a crown is connected to the movement by the winding system. It is fitted inside with sealing ring that is pressed onto the threaded pipe of the watch case to ensure water resistance. The best water tightness is obtained by a screwed in crown that is pressed or screwed on to the case middle. 

8) What's about the rubber strap? 

Chronovisor uses NBR (nitrile-butadiene rubber) strap. It is the most comfortable rubber strap on the market. NBR strap is very soft, stain resistant and very durable. While wearing, it does not pull hairs or attract lint. Compared to PU and Silicon, NBR strap is more expensive. It is the good way to go for swimming. NBR strap stands up very well to sun and salt, too. 

9) What's about the buckle? 

Unlike others, Chronovisor doesn't not use any OEM alloy buckle. The buckle of CVNM6102 is made of stainless steel. It is designed specially for Chronovisor with its pioneering spirit. 

10) What's the package included? 

Each Chronovisor package includes a piece of CVNM6102, one extra rubber strap, 16G USB flash drive (user manual ) and guarantee card. 

11) What's about the USB flash drive? 

Our Chronovisor USB flash drive is custom made with beautiful design. Each round shaped piece is with 16GB memory and installed with CVNM6102 user manual. 

12) Does Chronovisor need battery? What is automatic watch? How often should it be winding up ? 

Chronovisor doesn't need any battery and it is powered by you. It is winding automatically. By rotating the ratchet wheel 7.5 times (turning the crown 40 times), the mainspring becomes fully winded for the 1st time wearing. Afterward, there's unnecessary to wind up again if keep wearing it. 

13) What is the warranty? 

We've got you covered! Chronovisor offers 2 years limited warranty. During the warranty period, the repair fee is free of charge. However, this warranty doesn't cover normal wear and tear or incidental damage. 

14) When should I pay the money?

Your card will be charged as soon as the campaign has been officially funded and the time has run out on the campaign. You should see a charge on your account 3-5 days after the campaign ends. 

15) Is shipping charge included? 

Yes! The shipping charge is included to certain countries such as United States, United Kingdom, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, France, Germany, Denmark, Switzerland, Netherlands, Canada, Hong Kong, Taiwan. For the rest of the world, the shipping fee is US$ 26 

16) Can you guarantee the delivery dates? 

We've done our very best to demand and create a solid production plan. We are confident that we will meet our projected delivery dates. Should we miss projections, we'll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible. 

17) Can you help further if I still have a question? 

No problem! Please submit your questions to info@chronovisor.ch for further resistance. 

 

Risks and challenges

Chronovisor CVNM6102 is our first project on Indiegogo. We are experienced professionals in horology industry and work with world class manufacturing partners. After countless prototypes and rigorous testing of Chronovisor CVNM6102, now the watch is ready to go into full-scale production with its perfection.

We have anticipated and planned for potential risks and have built a rock-solid production and delivery plan. Therefore, we are confident that we will meet our projected delivery dates. However unforeseen issues can always happen....

Should we miss projections, we'll let you know why and make it right as quickly as possible. In the end, we will do whatever it takes to fulfill our promises.

To all our backers, we can assure you that you will have a wonderful and solid customer experience with us.

story:
What's the Better Sweater?

The Better Sweater is a customizable sweater that's tailored to your size and style preference and made individually just for you. Think of it as your perfectly engineered sweater made by robots from the future. 

The Better Sweaters is custom-made in the US with a unique, technical Merino wool yarn to keep you warm, dry and odor-free. Plus, it's guaranteed to fit. 

 

The Problem

While there seem to be many clothing options available, many people fit that clothing doesn't fit. Their sleeves fit too short or too long. Their torso length is too short or too long. The fabric is often too fine and shows the color of your shirt underneath. Their sweaters bunches up around the waist. And, it's often hard to replace a favorite staple sweater. 

That's because clothing is made for mannequins, not humans.

 

The Solution

We created a sweater with unparalleled fit

No one is a perfect S,M, L and XL. Most make unfortunate trade-offs. We offer custom sleeve and torso lengths for an uncompromised fit.

 

We removed that traditional muffin top bunching

We removed the elastic rib that bugged so many of you in traditional sweaters. We designed a straight-line t-shirt bottom to create a naturally slimming, bunch-free silhouette.

 

Made your way. No need to shop around

We offer both v neck and crew neck in the most requested colors - classic navy and black. No need to shop around looking for the perfect combination.

 

Reengineering a sweater with the best technical Merino

The Better Sweater is made with a unique, technical 100% Italian Merino wool that traps any extra wool hairs inside itself. The result in a contemporary, cleaner look that's cool to the touch and soft on the skin. 

The sweater is odor resistant, breathable and moisture wicking. The Better Sweater is designed to be loved and worn all year around. 

“Quality that would cost two or three times as much at Bergdorf or Barneys.” — Joe, TF Customer

Made individually with 3D-knitting robots and humans in USA

We developed a proprietary technology to customize and manufacture each of our products individually and on demand so that each product can be customized to your style, color and fit preferences. All made in the US with Japanese robots.

 

Made with zero waste

By making apparel custom and on demand, we're creating wanted products with a home. We're fighting the mass manufacturing that results in unwanted and unsold products that end up in landfills and contribute to the 15 million tons of textile waste each year.

Our business model and manufacturing method produces zero textile waste. Even more, our yarn comes from an Italian mill that uses solar power and a hydroelectric dam. Dammmmm.

Fit Guarantee

We proudly stand by all of our products. They are guaranteed to fit. If they don't fit the way you want the first time, we offer free exchanges for those in the US.  

Additional rewards

We are excited to offer some of our best-selling products as part of the rewards in this campaign. You can view many of them on www.thursdayfinest.com

All are customizable. All ship out for the holidays.

Select a perk on the right. We'll email you instructions on how to customize it to your preferences after your purchase.

 

The Founding Team

Why does it seem like there are so many products and yet nothing fits? Instead of mass producing products in sizes that only fit mannequins. Why not custom make them to fit each person?

Three years ago, Veronika and Michael, the husband and wife team behind Thursday Finest, set out to change the current fashion industry. To make customizable knitwear to fit each individual person and make it simple to get what you want. And do it all sustainably and in the US.⠀

We studied in Japan to become 3D-knit programmers and developed the technology and programming in-house to reengineer these everyday products. 

If you are excited about creating a better future together and want to get a customizable product for yourself or someone for the holidays, we'd love to make it for you. 

Accessories and gift cards ship in December.

 

FAQs:

How do I make a purchase?

  • Select a perk on the right and submit it. We will email you after you purchase with instructions on how to customize it. Thank you for your support!

How will I customize the sweater? How will you know my size?

  • At the conclusion of the campaign, we will send you a survey to take your sizing information. The questions are pretty easy. They are things you know right away (height, pant size etc.). We match that information to some data science on our side and customize your sweater to your perfect size.

What if the sweater doesn't fit me?

  • We stand by our products. If they don't fit the way you want the first time, we offer free exchanges for those in the US.  

Do you do international shipping?

  • We offering international shipping.
  • Taxes and duties are not included in the shipping price since each country is different and will need to be paid when receiving your order.

When will I receive my order?

  • If you're purchasing socks, hats, scarves or tie rewards - December
    • After placing your order on indiegogo for the type of product you want, we will email you with instructions on how to customize. Your order will be made before the completion of the campaign and will be mailed in December.
  • If you're purchasing a sweater gift card - December
    • Sweater gift cards will be mailed to the address on file the week of December 11th.
  • If you're purchasing a sweater - January
    • You will receive an email with instructions on how to customize your sweater at the end of the campaign. Sweaters will be made in January and February 2018 and mailed out on a rolling basis.

What if I don't know someone's size, but I want to them a gift?

  • You don't need to know any sizing when purchasing a reward. You will have time to specify this after purchase.

I want to get multiple items at once, but I'm having trouble at check out.

  • Each reward item needs to be purchased individually.
  • If you're trying to buy several items at once or want a corporate deal for a larger quantity, please email us at humans@thursdayfinest.com.

I have more questions, who can I ask?

  • Email us: humans@thursdayfinest.com and we'll be happy to help!
