story:
Golden Hour

At Golden Hour we believe that fashion and function are not mutually exclusive. Making advancements in both we offer the best solution on both ends of the lens, with style and clarity. 

Capturing a clear view of your life's adventures, creating memories that last. We bring you sunglasses to both look and see the best in.

The problems we are solving...

  1. The unimaginative and stagnant designs plaguing brands traditionally known for the high quality of their materials and optical performance
  2. An overemphasis on fashion at the expense of poor lens quality and cheap poly materials mainly on the part of major designer brands
  3. A lack of commitment to eye health and sight (primarily in the developing world)

 

 

With a classical emphasis on quality and an innovative take on design, we have sourced the purest optical lens clarity and paired them with new generation polarised filter. Designed to reduce sun glare for day-long comfort and lifelong eye health, once you’ve seen the world through our high resolution lenses, you’ll never look back in less. 

Using classic proportions and symmetry to naturally suit on a wide variety of face shapes, our bespoke designs created in London are unique.

 

Life is a series of sights. We want you to both look and see the best in it.

 

 

The power is in the glasses

More than an accessory, sunglasses should enhance our experience of what life has to offer; enhancing the normal light-filtering capabilities of your eyes and protecting against the sun's damaging ultraviolet rays. No one is immune to sunlight-related eye problems. It's up to you to keep your eyes healthy. 

 

 

Lens Quality

 

Golden Hours Polarised CR-39  lenses:

  • Daylong visual comfort - Because your eyes aren’t constantly challenged by glare.
  • Enhances clarity of vision- Gives greater contrast so you can even see past reflections into water!
  • Reduces eyestrain - frequent adjustments to the glare from reflections is taxing on the eyes and can lead to fatigue
  • Conveys colours faithfully to enrich your world.

 

     

    Social Impact

    At Golden Hour our commitment to sight is so instrumental to our founding that we have decided to make a lasting impact on the lives of families in less developed countries, by helping to restore lost or partial vision. 

     

    With each pair of sunglasses purchased we are giving 10% to our charity partner “Mercy Ships”

    Currently docked in Cameroon, West Africa, Mercy Ship’s hospital ship is reaching people in remote places that desperately need care. With relatively simple eye operations Mercy Ship’s doctors are changing people’s lives. It is through your support that Golden Hour is able to give back the empowering gift of sight.

     

    By pre-ordering your sunglasses today you will not only be investing in outstanding quality, but also supporting independent style, progressive change and a culture that values vision.

     

     

    Our Styles

    Named after the places that inspired them!

     

     

     

    Our Case

    With a unique design that folds up to slip in your pocket!

     

    Our perks

    Choose your favourite pair of sunglasses!

     

     

    Technical specifications

     

    Frame

    No two people are the same. That is why our frames are adjustable, and designed to naturally fit a variety of face shapes. Using premium frame acetate from Italian company Mazzucchelli, all our frames can be hand adjusted for individual comfort. 

     

     

     

     

    Hinges

    No more floppy hinges. By using a five barrel hinge for twice the strength, every part of your glasses will stay right where they should be. Fitted with teflon coated screws from top German manufacturer OBE, they will stay secure through all the adventures ahead of you. 

     

    Lenses

    Our lenses are fully polarised CR39 lenses of the highest quality, with CE approved 400 UVA/UVB rating. 

     

    Polarised Sunglasses

    Sunlight is absorbed or reflected in many directions. Sunlight reflected from a horizontal surface (e.g. land, water or cars) is often reflected back horizontally, producing a very strong glare. For us, it means that these reflections cause a lot of interference with our vision.

     

    Normal sunglasses provide basic protection against both vertical and horizontal UV rays. However, they don’t diminish the glare from reflected horizontal rays.

    Our Polarized glasses have a built-in filter that permits only vertical light rays to pass through and almost totally blocks horizontal rays to eliminate glare. This is most noticeable when driving, being near water or near any other bright white surfaces (like reading a book outdoors in the sun).

     

    Validations

    We all know about the threats of sun related skin damage, yet few realise the vulnerability of our eyes. Ever felt visual discomfort after a day in the sun? That’s sunburn, and like sunburn, it leads to far more terrifying conditions as damage accumulates over the years. 

    The ultraviolet rays from the sun (particularly UVB) are the same spectrum of ultraviolet that causes the skin to burn, and are most damaging to the eyes. You may think it would be reasonable to at least protect yourself with any sunglasses, right?

    WRONG! As we wear sunglasses our pupils naturally dilate to allow more light through. If the lenses are not filtering the light appropriately, this can be more damaging than not wearing sunglasses at all. Without sufficient UV protection we will absorb even more of the sun's harmful ultraviolet. That’s reason enough to choose your lenses carefully. Not only do we have the best UV protection with optical grade lens clarity but we’ve taken it one step further: polarised filtration.

     

     

    Where we come from

    What’s next

    • Mercy Ship doctors will, with your support, continue to transform people's lives by restoring their lost or partial sight. Mercy Ship helps the people who need it most
    • Releasing more designs, styles and products, based on your feedback
    • We’ll continue to look out for the latest lens technology and advance our products accordingly
    • Sharing all our top travel tips and locations through our official blog, so that you will have never have to miss out on an adventure and new memory
    • Coming to a store near you. Our sunglasses will make their way to fashion retailers in different locations. Take advantage of our discounted price now, before they go up back to their original retail prices

     

    Why we have chosen crowdfunding

    Crowdfunding is an innovative way to get involved in new and more advanced projects. Driven by the same innovative principles, we see this method in harmony with our product design and philosophy. We hope you do as well.

     

    Risks/challenges

    We have taken the risk of production already, so that you don't have to. Most projects that are crowdfunding are waiting for your backing before in order to start manufacturing. This might lead to unforeseen delays, problems and costs. We have our products ready to ship. The only thing that is still left for you is to back our campaign, and you will soon be looking great in and through your new sunnies.

     

    We’ve climbed the mountain, now appreciate the view with us.

story:
Introduction 

In an increasingly complex world, the best tools are the simplest.

Founded in the UK by furniture designer and watch collector Charlie Fowler, alkin watches is born out of a long-held desire to build a watch brand uncompromising in it core values of high quality, democratic design that will stand the test of time.

During his time as a designer Charlie has become increasingly passionate about products that are built to last and go on a journey with you, but understands that it’s often hard to make this available to everyone. From the outset, his fundamental aim was to make the alkin Model One an accessible automatic designed with simplicity, functionality and longevity firmly in mind. 

Design

The case, dial, hands and branding have all been designed from scratch by Charlie, while the Arabic numerals are designed by British typographer Gareth Hague. The Model One, with its pared-back style, has evolved into a watch with form and function in equal measure while still retaining its character and identity. All elements have been distilled to create a simple, visually balanced piece that offers maximum utility and versatility.

The product development journey for the Model One took over two years, with numerous prototypes and revisions made to ensure that the watch was just right. During this time we built strong relationships with our suppliers to ensure that the very best standards of quality, consistency and attention to detail can be delivered in production.

Specifications

The dial and crystal 

Every detail has been considered to perfectly balance the dial and make it as legible as possible in all light conditions. The satin black is combined with white pad-printed numbers and minute markers, while the hand-applied hour markers are raised up to add a sense of depth. The hour markers, numbers, and hands are all are lumed with pure white Swiss Super-LumiNova BGW9, both for great visibility in low-level light and at night. 

In order to preserve the simplicity and symmetry in the dial we chose not to go with a date window. This also allows for the watch to be more of a ‘grab-and-go’ piece, with no need to set the date if you haven’t worn it for a few days. 

A domed sapphire crystal at the front and a flat sapphire crystal on the back have been used to achieve the highest level of clarity and durability. Sapphire is immensely scratch resistant (only diamond is tougher) and far superior to cheaper mineral alternatives. Applied to the inside of the crystal is a multi-layered, anti-reflective coating that further improves performance in all lighting conditions.

The case 

The 42mm case has a utilitarian style with proportions that give it a presence on the wrist without being overly bulky. The short lugs (50mm overall) help to balance out the larger case diameter, while the screw-down crown is located at the 4 o’clock position for maximum comfort. Due to the short lug length we have added a small cut-out in the case to facilitate thicker straps. 

The case is manufactured from surgical grade 316L stainless steel, considered the best quality steel for watches and used by the world’s leading watch manufacturers. The case is rated at 10 ATM/100M water resistant, which means it can be worn in water but is not rated for diving.

The case is available in either raw stainless steel or black PVD finish. Different surface finishing processes have been chosen for the two case options to make the very best of each colour. The stainless steel version has been brushed in alternate directions on the bezel and case to create a more elemental look, while the black PVD version has been given a fine bead blast finish to produce a very flat matt finish overall.

The movement

We chose the Seiko NH35A, as it has consistently proven itself to be an immensely durable and reliable movement. This brilliant piece of Japanese engineering boasts great accuracy and has a 41-hour power reserve, so will keep itself wound if worn every day. It also has a hacking second hand, which means that when the crown is pulled out the second hand stops, making it very easy to set the time accurately. The fact that it is made by one of the most respected watch manufacturers in the world not only represents a universal seal of quality but also means it can easily be serviced anywhere around the globe.

So that you can appreciate the simple magic of the automatic movement every day, the Model One has a sapphire crystal display case back. To add a touch of individuality the alkin logo has been laser-engraved on to the rotor.

The straps

Our German-made vegetable-tanned leather straps use organic tanning techniques instead of the immensely polluting chromium tanning process most commonly used in commercial leather production. Despite being made for thick 3.5mm hide, the straps are very supple and soft, and will only improve with age. They are made by people who have been crafting straps for generations — the quality and finish are second to none. 

The straps will come in a choice of three colours: black, brown and cognac. The buckle will be finished to match the case and laser-engraved with the alkin logo.

The double watch pouch

Each Model One will ship in a vegetable-tanned leather travel pouch that can be used throughout the watch’s lifetime. The leather we have chosen for the pouch has a raw colour and finish and is much stiffer than the straps. With time and use the leather will slowly soften and the finish will darken and age beautifully.

Funding process

We reached our funding goal for our first crowdsourcing campaign back in April of this year, so all orders have now been placed with our manufacturing partners.

By pledging for this project you are placing a pre-order for a watch, which means you will have to wait for the watch to be made. In return you will have a high quality automatic watch at a discounted price.

Giving 1% back

We recognise the impact of just creating more stuff, so have put the sustainability of the alkin brand central to the business mission. Fundamentally, designing a product that is rooted in longevity is key to keeping the product in use for as long as possible. The quality of the components and a reliable, widely used movement that can be very easily serviced or repaired are essential factors. 

In addition to this, if we are successful with our funding, we will pledge to annually donate 1% of gross profit to environmental causes around the world.

Thank you

A huge thank you to everyone who has given their support on this journey and taken the time to follow this campaign. It has occasionally been very challenging, but has always remained a real labour of love. To achieve funding and see the alkin brand grow would be a long-held dream come true. 

If you have any questions please do not hesitate to get in touch, either through Kickstarter or directly at info@alkinwatches.com.

All the best, Charlie Fowler
story_txt: Introduction In an increasingly complex world, the best tools are the simplest.Founded in the UK by furniture designer and watch collector Charlie Fowler, alkin watches is born out of a long-held desire to build a watch brand uncompromising in it core values of high quality, democratic design that will stand the test of time.During his time as a designer Charlie has become increasingly passionate about products that are built to last and go on a journey with you, but understands that it’s often hard to make this available to everyone. From the outset, his fundamental aim was to make the alkin Model One an accessible automatic designed with simplicity, functionality and longevity firmly in mind. DesignThe case, dial, hands and branding have all been designed from scratch by Charlie, while the Arabic numerals are designed by British typographer Gareth Hague. The Model One, with its pared-back style, has evolved into a watch with form and function in equal measure while still retaining its character and identity. All elements have been distilled to create a simple, visually balanced piece that offers maximum utility and versatility.The product development journey for the Model One took over two years, with numerous prototypes and revisions made to ensure that the watch was just right. story:
Custom pockets and denim-style printing make the GIGA Jacket a combination of fashion and function.  

 

 

When it's not convenient to wear, it's convenient to carry. The jacket flips inside out to become a bag – which can also be used as a pillow.

 

Our phone carrying pouch allows you to interact with the screen through a clear cover. The GIGA Jacket is travel-friendly with a passport sized pocket and another pocket designed for boarding passes. 

A two-way zipper makes it quick and easy to access the GIGA Jacket's internal pockets.

No more forgetting your scarf or eye mask, the GIGA Jacket comfortably carries them.

Use what you need. The facemask and windproof hood are removable, with the GIGA Jacket's scarf a pull away.

The outside eyewear loop gives you easy access to your glasses and the headphone cable loop puts an end to tangled cords. 

It's warm. Thumb loops make gloves windproof, and when the GIGA Jacket is folded into bag form, its thermal material keeps drinks at the right temperature.

We predict a September delivery date, meaning a production time of several months and longer than traditional down jackets. Why do we need the extra time? The GIGA Jacket’s many features means we will be working carefully to get every unit right, from concealed scarf to iPad pocket. Without unforeseen challenges, we are confident you will receive your jacket before next Autumn.

Referral Program One

FREE additional face mask for you to replacement, just share!

Face mask is easily to get dirty and need replacement often. You can get an additional face mask FOR FREE just by sharing our Indiegogo Campaign on your Social Media! It takes less than 60 seconds and is super easy to do.

Just click on the Facebook or Twitter Icon found at the very top of the campaign, right beside the “Back it” button.

Once you’ve done that, go on to our Indiegogo "COMMENTS" page and: — Let us know you shared our Campaign! :-)

That’s it! Something as simple as:

"Just shared on my Facebook (insert the link here) and I’m so excited about the GIGA Jacket because it can give me a good sleep once I need during travel"

Referral Program Two

If you are interested in multi-functional clothing, this 3-in-1 pillow is a perfect fit. It can be used as a scarf, a shawl, or a pillow- perfect for long flights and cold weather.

There are three different ways to make the pillow yours:  

Refer a friend to GIGA Jacket via a tracking link. Please click here to apply your personal link. Or email us: support@micronovelty.com  

Simply pledge US $30 to receive it as a perk

Or pledge US $149 to receive it together with one Giga Jacket.

We know what we're doing, and we have already started preparing the factory fabrication for the GIGA Jacket. Once we hit our goal, delivery should be no problem.

Supply Chain Risk: we're incredibly proud of our supply chain and have a lot of confidence, but shipment can get tricky and we may not be able to stay on schedule if overwhelmed by backers. Border customs also sometimes causes unplanned issues.

These factors will not stop delivery, but they may delay delivery of the GIGA Jacket.We will be transparent and provide updates if such issues arise.

story:
Silk Squirrel Gone Nuts

Painting and designing are my life. As a silk painter, I feel blessed that people love my hand-painted, one-of-a-kind designs inspired from nature. As one buyer recently said, “From flower close-ups to dramatic landscapes, Tina’s exquisite art lifts my spirit every time I see it. I love the vibrant, shimmering quality of her silk art, and it’s also irresistibly touchable.”

But recently, I have found that demand is outstripping my ability to create new pieces, making it hard to keep them on the shelves. And since my creations each take long hours to paint, many people who really appreciate them can’t afford to buy them.

Thinking about this problem, I have been dreaming, researching and planning how I can bring my art to more people in a more affordable way. I have experimented with reproducing my art as wearable silk, and have gotten strong preliminary orders and sales from my test market boutiques. As a result, I am excited to pursue the path of creating “art to wear.”

These pieces will take the form of gorgeous silk scarves, shawls, and ponchos, all printed with my colorful paintings. I have tested the quality of the silk reproductions done by a respected textile printing company, and found the results meet my high standards. The resulting pieces have great depth of color and the silk used has a wonderfully fine, floating quality.

Your support will help me realize my objective to market these unique pieces of wearable silk art via wholesale trade shows. Our focus is on high-end fashion boutiques and retailers. The larger goal is to share the beauty of my silk art with more of the world. Please view my website at www.silksquirrel.com.  

My Artistic Journey

I've always been creative and excelled in art. In college, I started studying art therapy, but soon realized that creating art was my true passion. However, I never felt a strong pull toward any one medium. After dabbling in many different techniques and mediums, I moved away from fine art toward a more practical approach and earned a degree in business. My business training is now proving vital in my endeavors because it has prepared me to take my art to this next level.  Through conducting market research, writing a business plan, managing cash flow, calculating investment needs, defining my  market and  finding my products unique niche “Silk Squirrel” is on its’ way!

After college, I went to work for an international jewelry designer. My career was extremely rewarding – I was involved in all aspects of jewelry design and creation, and traveled to many trade shows across the US.  However, the travelling and extreme time demand of meeting those fashion deadlines took a strain on my husband and our new baby girl. Both my husband and I traveled for work, but quality child care was scarce. We eventually realized that one of us needed to stay home to care for our daughter and our new son. So I changed direction again, earned my preschool certificate and opened my own child care and preschool center.

That was over ten years ago. My child care endeavor has been very successful and rewarding. But I needed something more. One night a few years ago, I was invited to an adult art night to paint a silk scarf. I had not painted for 15 years! But when I touched the dyes to the silk, something in me came alive! It was like being awakened after a long sleep. I couldn't stop painting! I had finally found my art medium, and my wandering art spirit had found its true home! Never have I felt so in tune with what I was meant to do.

As I began silk painting for myself, exploring the medium and the dyes and honing my art design skills, people and businesses started ordering my art. The iridescence of the silk, the floppy squirrel hair brushes, the texture of the fabric and the rich dye colors set themselves apart from any other medium. I found that watercolor paper and canvas simply could not compete with the versatility of silk. I would stay up all night in the calm of a quiet house, designing and painting! I have since taken a few workshops from Master Silk Artists from San Francisco, Washington and learned new ideas and techniques at a specialized retreat in France. More recently, I have begun teaching silk painting classes myself, as the Resident Artist at Yosemite for the past two summers, at a week-long workshop in France, and at Eureka Studio Arts.

Much as I love the fine art world, I believe my artwork also has the potential to be accessible to a much broader range of people in the form of wearable silk art. As I began to redesign my painted wall art into wearable silk art, I realized that I must find a way to increase the production, because there are only so many hours in the day! I began researching and sourcing how to edit and redesign my original artwork into a wearable silk art form. The Silk Squirrel Wearable Art clothing line was born!

You are seeing samples of the textile designs after professional digital editing but before professional photography (see timeline below). These are my “proof of concept” first runs that are selling consistently.

Business Timeline

Planning for the Trade Show circuit is vital to my business endeavor.

August/September  / Month 1 & 2

·  Research the best trade shows for my work

·  Edit / redesign paintings into scarf, shawl, poncho forms

October / Month 3

·  Send designs to be printed

·  Receive prototypes… make adjustments as needed

·  Reorder  for Sponsors and final booth samples

·  Order booth updates; lighting, flooring

November / Month 4

·  Receive Sponsor’s Orders and prototypes

·  Ship Sponsor’s Orders by December 10, 2015

·  Photography session

·  Order brochure

·  Order banners for booth

·  Book lodging

December / Month 5

·  Inventory, price and tag all items for shows

·  Do mock set up of booth to ensure everything is in tip-top shape for shows

·  Pack items and booth materials in preparation for January shows!!

January / Month 6

·  Attend wholesale trade show

·  Take and Process Orders


Your Support

As per the budget below, I estimate it will cost about $25,000 to allow me to scale up my art business as envisioned. To make this possible, I am asking for your help. This support will be instrumental in allowing me to share my uplifting designs from nature with the world. In return, this could be a truly unique holiday gift-giving option for you ! And I will provide each of my sponsors with a hand signed gift from the list. Thank you so much!

Crowd Funding Amount- $25,000

Budget

Projected Expense

Additional Information

 Graphic Designer

$3,000

must be knowledgeable about fashion

 Photographer

$1,500

must be knowledgeable about fashion

 Brochure

$500

High-end, eye catching

 Samples from Silk Printer

$6,000

high quality, quick production

Tradeshow Expenses

$8,000

Update booth, lighting, flooring, banners, and cover travel expenses

  Projected Retention for Orders

$6,000

To do the actual processing of the orders received at the trade shows

Total Estimated Budget

$25,000

story:
Bisou is a digital necklace & magnet that will allow you to express yourself in a totally unique & fun way!  

It is quite a fun gadget that you can dictate depending on your mood. It allows you to upload or choose from numerous designs through the Bisou app and wear them on your pendant, which has an outstanding round AMOLED display. It is a conversation starter and can match pretty much everything you can wear. 

Limit? Your imagination.

 

 

It stands at the crossroads of fashion & tech. It is both, just like our team. We are a couple of troublemakers from Istanbul, the city of East & West, and we are driven by design and innovation.

We envisioned Bisou to be the streetwear you will bond with.

Our prototype was the first step to make this possible, this crowdfunding is the second. With your support, we’ll be able to mass manufacture it. We have a plan set in place and we are ready to execute.

 

The Bisou App (Bazaar) has been designed to enable you as a user to customize your pendant in the easiest way possible. It transfers the visuals to the pendant through Wi-Fi and all the other communications are done via BLE.

The user can upload their own images or choose designs among free visuals curated and offered by our team but also can purchase designs that belong to street artists, designers, illustrators. This way, we aim to enrich the Bisou experience and show our support to street artists. After all, Bisou is a #streetwear accessory and it aims to make street art even more 'street' with people wearing the murals/designs on their necklaces. 

For instance, Leo Lunatic, the street artist The Guardian readers chose to be one of the 15 best street artists in the world, will be displaying his work on Bisou.
 

                                                        Some of Leo's artworks

Apart from these, we are working on bringing lost stories back to life. This Albanian woman, below, inspired us to share the stories like hers with the world. 

 

The shooting of the picture dates as far back as 1907. It was taken during war but her style stunned us. Considering the conditions at the time, her look is just mesmerizing. We'll share her story underneath the 'preview' of your Bisou with her picture in the app so you will know more about her when you 'wear' her. This, we want to apply to interesting people, views, characters as we bump into them along the way.

 

 

 

 

 

                                                        Like Father & Like Son

 

The prototype on the left - Bisou 'The Neanderthalensis'- is our first one. It was a simpler version that just had a BLE connection, When we started our R&D, we wanted to make sure we had a working prototype (minimum viable product) to prove ourselves we can go further. 

Bisou comes with it's adjustable chain so you can adjust it to the size you want. We've observed the size choice varies a lot depending on the culture, gender etc. so we decided an adjustable chain would make everyone happy.


Make your laptop more entertaining


If there is one thing we are very excited for you to experience is how beautiful the display of Bisou looks. It is a 1.4-inch full circle AMOLED display with 400x400xRGB screen resolution which is the best round display in these dimensions. Because what you wear matters and the display on Bisou is a huge part of the experience, we did not want to just use a random display to soften our process but went with the best one we can find.

 

 

During our R&D, Bisou's design has been perfected by jewelry craftsmen. They were as excited about Bisou as we are since they believe Bisou can transform the jewelry world. 

 


"Müslüm Usta" while working

 

             

               

      Güney Köse - Founder/ Biz Dev                          Orkun Aşa - Software Dev

             

                   

         Sezgin Kır - Hardware Engineer                               Berk Çar - Designer

 

 

                                             

                                              Kutay Burunsuz / Graphic Designer

Flipbooks of your favorite GIFs! Some say they inspired the conceptualization of movies. (20 $)

 

 

 

 

Display: 1.4-inch full circle AMOLED display 400x400xRGB

Material: 7075 Aluminum, Gorilla Glass

Battery: 350 mAh Durability: 12+ hrs (still designs), 5+ hrs (animated designs)

Connectivity: Bluetooth 4.1 (Bluetooth Low Energy), Wi-fi (Single-band 2.4GHz IEEE 802.11b/g/n) BCM43438

Sensors: Microphone

Compatibility: IOS/Android

Chain: Adjustable Chain

Dimensions: Diameter 45mm, Weight: 30 gr, Thickness: 8mm

Charging: Micro USB

Memory: 4 GB eMMC

 

Risks & Challenges

Because Bisou contains a lot of components, we depend on our suppliers. To ensure a smooth process, Güney has been in close touch with them and is planning to visit every supplier next month. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We will appreciate spreading the word about us! Share us on Facebook and we'll love you for it.
story_txt:
Bisou is a digital necklace & magnet that will allow you to express yourself in a totally unique & fun way!  It is quite a fun gadget that you can dictate depending on your mood. It allows you to upload or choose from numerous designs through the Bisou app and wear them on your pendant, which has an outstanding round AMOLED display. It is a conversation starter and can match pretty much everything you can wear. 
Limit? Your imagination.
 

 
It stands at the crossroads of fashion & tech. It is both, just like our team. We are a couple of troublemakers from Istanbul, the city of East & West, and we are driven by design and innovation.
We envisioned Bisou to be the streetwear you will bond with.

Our prototype was the first step to make this possible, this crowdfunding is the second. With your support, we’ll be able to mass manufacture it. We have a plan set in place and we are ready to execute.

story:
When we designed the Venturi belt with you in mind, not a single corner was cut. "Details matter, it's worth waiting to get it right." -Steve Jobs

Every Venturi Belt comes with at least 5 inches of adjustability. You can adjust it bigger one day or smaller the next. The best thing about the Venturi Belt is: It can stay adjusted, but it's always adjustable.

We at Venturi Belt Co. have designed the perfect belt. Adjustable but always adjusted so it is ready to go every time. Casual but classy for every occasion, with no flap hanging out and no holes to slow you down.  Made from the best materials available like military grade webbing that's wrapped in abrasion resistant ballistic nylon and a low-profile aircraft grade aluminum buckle.

Your Venturi Belt will be available in four different colors, black, gray, brown, and the BACKERS CHOICE Belt color which has been voted on. The winner is Canvas "Desert Sand".

We received numerous messages requesting a black on black buckle. You asked and we listened, we’re calling it our MIDNIGHT BUCKLE! That now makes 20 COLOR COMBINATIONS!

We've had a lot of great feedback on our video and how our page is coming along. We mentioned in our video that we are the little guy. We aren’t like some of those projects that spent thousands of dollars on hiring a videographer and graphic designer. We aren’t professionals, but we’re determined and resourceful. There is a lot of trial and error, and a lot of fun along the way. If you like seeing behind the scenes let us know in the comments and we'll add some more!

Buckles are in, just waiting on belts to arrive before we start shipping. Till then, Nala the guard dog will watch over everyone's buckles.

story:
Short Summary

I have been living in Las Vegas for 15 years, raising my three daughters and working on all kinds of projects.  My daughters and female friends with smartphones complain about how to carry them  as well as ID and money without a purse.  I worked with jewelry people as well as doing market research with women to make different designs and start a fashion statement on this product.  It is now time to take it to the real world with your help.

I am a mechanical engineer that has worked in many fields, designing mobile gaming devices, TV sets, scuba equipment, you name it and I may have worked on it.


What The Idea Is:

Wear your smarphone as a fashion statement.  The bracelet can be worn with or without the optional smartphone case, allowing for mix and match combinations.  The smartphone case also holds your ID card as well as a debit/credit card.  Now you don't need a purse to carry your essentials, and also make a fashion statement with these unique designs.

A prototype has been built using 3D printers to ensure everything works correctly as designed.  8 different designs have been created and tested to make sure the modular design works and is sturdy.

Manufacturing of the injection molding tools needs to begin by mid November at the latest to allow the 8-10 weeks of cutting.  This will allow for parts to be pulled from the tools in mid January, 2013 and production parts by the end of January 2013.  Release is planned for mid February, 2013.  Tooling vendors in California as well as China are looking at prototypes right now to finalize costing.  Advertising will be done on the internet, art/craft shows, and working with shopping malls that show smartphone accesories.

The idea is under Patent Pending Status for design as well as utility with the U.S. Patent Office.

Money will be used to pay for tooling cost, patent attorney finalization, advertizing, and production parts.

Looking forward to your help and seeing this great project everywhere making our fashion statement.  And you get to say you helped and are a part of it!

story:
Hey there! I've started dabbling with making polish and I love it! As a full-time new mommy, I don't have time to get a job so I decided I want to do something on the side. I love nail polish and have already made a few sales, but I don't have enough to continue going! With your help, I can get my business going strong and help provide for my family!

WHAT I NEED!

To get things started I will need $500 for suspension base (A polish base that suspends glitter instead of it falling to the bottom), solvent resistant glitters (These are glitters that will not contort, warp, bleed or dissolve in the polish base), pigments, micas and bottles! 

 

My Current Etsy Shop!

http://www.etsy.com/shop/dlishpolish
(Lots of my polishes have sold out, these are the remaining.)
 
I've currently had 7 orders in the one week I've been opened! 

 

 

If you can't donate that's okay, too!

All I ask is that you help get the word out about my cause and my site! 

 

 

Thanks everyone! I really can't wait to start providing for my family again and doing something I love!
